Unable to create a navy that could stand up to the unmatched British Navy, he could not reach and destroy his most implacable foe.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]For fifteen years Napoleon marched and counter-marched triumphantly across Europe, until finally defeated by yet another coalition at Leipzig, and then a year later at Waterloo. For more details about this extraordinary warlord, see Napoleon's civilopedia entry.
TXT_KEY_GOLD_RUNNINGOUT_HEADING2_BODY: If your treasury is at zero and you're running a negative budget, the difference is deducted from your Science, and can eventually cause units to be disbanded. Beware: this can seriously slow down your acquisition of new technology, which can leave you extremely vulnerable to attack by more advanced neighbors. Get your budget in order as quickly as possible!
TXT_KEY_CIV5_INDUSTRIAL_ARTILLERY_TEXT: As technology has advanced, artillery has assumed ever greater importance on the battlefield. The 19th century guns of the Napoleonic and American Civil Wars are gone, having been replaced by ever-larger, more accurate and deadlier weapons as the years have passed. The German 88 mm gun is one of the best and most versatile artillery weapons of the Second World War. Originally designed as an anti-aircraft weapon, the gun proved so successful as an anti-tank weapon that variants were created for just that purpose.
TXT_KEY_WONDER_KREMLIN_DESC: "Kremlin" is a Russian word which denotes a fortified complex of buildings in the center of a city. It is most often used to refer to the Kremlin in the city of Moscow, a remarkable set of buildings which hold much of the Russian government. The Kremlin sits on a hill overlooking the Moskva River. In one form or the other, fortified structures have been in that location for almost 1000 years. The site was named "Kremlin" in the 14th century.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The Kremlin is within a triangular, walled area about 68 acres in extent. The walls are of red brick, with pencil-like towers at the corners and entrances. Many of the buildings are painted white with yellow trim and green roofs that look quite cheerful from a distance. The Cathedral of the Dormition, constructed in the 1470s, is the oldest building in the complex. Two other cathedrals lie within its walls, as do a surprising number of palaces, the Kremlin Palace being the largest.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The Kremlin has seen many great figures rise and fall within its walls. Ivan the Terrible built the Palace of Facets in the Kremlin. In the Great Patriotic War (WWII), Josef Stalin drove the German invaders from the gates of Moscow - perhaps the greatest service that any Russian ruler has ever performed for his country. (It was also here that Stalin planned the systematic extermination of millions of his own people.) It was here that Mikhail Gorbachev oversaw the dissolution of the Soviet Union. Today, the Kremlin holds the government of the Russian Federation.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]To whatever use it might be put in the future, the Kremlin will always stand as a mighty monument to Russia's past - for it has seen the best and the worst of that great nation.
TXT_KEY_WONDER_HUBBLE_HELP: 2 free Great Scientists appear near the City where the Wonder was built. Provides a free Spaceship Factory in the city in which it is built. +25% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production when building Spaceship Parts.
TXT_KEY_MAP_SCRIPT_SKIRMISH_TUNDRA_HELP: A frigid landscape with only small pockets of more fertile plains.
TXT_KEY_NOTIFICATION_VICTORY_CATEGORY_FO: {1_CivName:textkey} has won FOURTH place in the {2_Era:textkey} Era with {3_Victory:textkey}!
TXT_KEY_EO_SPY_COUP_DISABLED_WAIT_TT: {1_SpyRank} {2_SpyName} may not attempt a coup in {3_CityName} yet because they have not completed surveillance there.
TXT_KEY_WONDER_HUBBLE_DESC: Named for renowned American astronomer Edwin Hubble, the Hubble Space Telescope has proven to be among the most crucial astronomical research tools ever developed. Launched in 1990, the telescope has continually provided breathtaking images of far-off constellations and nebulas, attracting widespread attention from both scientists and the general public. As the only space telescope capable of being repaired by astronauts, the service life of the Hubble has been continually extended through a series of space walks. However, despite its notable legacy, the Hubble Space Telescope will be replaced in 2018 by the more advanced James Webb Space Telescope.
TXT_KEY_WONDER_HIMEJICASTLE_DESC: Himeji Castle is an extraordinary Japanese castle and one of the most beautiful structures in the world. First constructed in the 14th century and then massively rebuilt and extended in the late 16th-early 17th by Kuroda Yoshitaka and Ikeda Terumasa, Himeji Castle is a tall, imposing multi-story structure constructed of stone and wood, and featuring a brilliant white exterior and a series of beautifully curved rooftops. It is nicknamed "White Heron Castle."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Himeji Castle is surrounded by a confusing maze of paths leading to the keep. The walls and gates were designed to force an invading army to travel in a series of concentric circles with many dead ends before reaching the main gate. This would string out the attackers and allow the defenders to fire on the vanguard many times during the approach. The ingenious system was not put to the test, as the castle was never attacked during the medieval era.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Although the surrounding area was heavily damaged by Allied bombing during World War II, the castle was almost entirely unscathed. It is currently undergoing major restoration, and it remains one of the most popular tourist sites in Japan.
TXT_KEY_WONDER_HANGINGGARDENS_QUOTE: [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"I think that if ever a mortal heard the word of God it would be in a garden at the cool of the day."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - F. Frankfort Moore[NEWLINE][TAB]
TXT_KEY_BUILDING_PYRAMID_STRATEGY: The Pyramids provide a free granary in every city. They also give you +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and +1 Great Engineer point. Granaries increase a city's food intake by +2 food per turn. This earliest of Wonders will speed city growth for the entirety of the game, making it one of the most potent Wonders of all.
TXT_KEY_LEADER_ATTILA_ATTACKED_2: I would have expected this treachery from Rome, not from you. No matter, you all bleed red.
TXT_KEY_TECH_METAL_CASTING_QUOTE: [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"When pieces of bronze or gold or iron break, the metal-smith welds them together again in the fire, and the bond is established."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]  - Sri Guru Granth Sahib[NEWLINE][TAB]
TXT_KEY_BUILDING_LIONS_GATE_HELP: [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and [ICON_GOLD] Gold costs of acquiring new tiles reduced by 25% in this city.
TXT_KEY_PEDIA_QUOTE_BLOCK_GCONCEPTS: [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"The absurd is the essential concept and the first truth."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]  - Albert Camus [NEWLINE][TAB]
TXT_KEY_WONDER_GREAT_WALL_HELP: Enemy land Units must expend 1 extra [ICON_MOVES] movement per Tile inside your territory. Provides Walls for free in the city in which it is built. Upon discovering Dynamite, The Great Wall becomes obsolete.
TXT_KEY_CIVILOPEDIA_LEADERS_GEORGE_TEXT_: Although a loyalist, Washington too chafed under the growing burden of taxation placed on the Colonies by Parliament (largely imposed to help pay off debts from the recent French and Indian War). As tensions grew and England ratcheted up the pressure on the Colonies, Washington's position grew more radical, and by 1768 he declared himself ready to take up arms against England whenever his country called him. By 1774 Washington was a member of the Continental Congress, the first truly national organization of the nascent country. When actual fighting broke out in and around Boston in 1775, Washington was named as commander of the military forces of all of the Colonies, a post he maintained once actual independence was declared in 1776.
TXT_KEY_WONDER_GREAT_FIREWALL_TEXT: The Great Firewall is a restrictive internet monitoring and censorship program used to control the flow of information available to a civilization's people through the internet. By limiting the public's access to potentially volatile information available online, government agencies can limit potential backlash and other dissension regarding unpopular policies and government programs.
TXT_KEY_WONDER_GREAT_FIREWALL_QUOTE: [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Distrust and caution are the parents of security."[NEWLINE]- Benjamin Franklin[NEWLINE][TAB]
TXT_KEY_LEADER_ISABELLA_DEMANDTRIBUTE_HA: My friend, I believe that Heaven would want you to give us the following.
TXT_KEY_WONDER_GREATWALL_QUOTE: [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"The art of war teaches us to rely not on the likelihood of the enemy's... not attacking, but rather on the fact that we have made our position unassailable."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Sun Tzu[NEWLINE][TAB]
TXT_KEY_WONDER_GREATWALL_DESC: The Great Wall of China is one of the largest and most famous man-made constructions in the entire world. Chinese rulers built the Great Wall to ward off attack from nomadic tribesmen living in modern Manchuria and Mongolia. Interestingly, the Great Wall was not designed to keep the nomads out - the Chinese knew it was all but impossible to defend such a long border - it was designed to make it difficult for the raiders to carry off loot, thus making raids far less profitable and thus less worth the risks involved.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]There have actually been five different "Great Walls" built by different Chinese dynasties. The first four were constructed of earth and have since all but disappeared. The current wall was built almost entirely by the Ming Dynasty between 1368 and 1640 AD. This wall was constructed on a grander scale, using more permanent materials (like stone). The Ming wall stretches for 3,948 miles from Shanhai Pass on the Bohai Gulf in the east to Lop Nur in the southeast portion of Xinjiang's Uygur Autonomous Region in the west. This was the region where the Silk Road first entered China, and a series of watchtowers which could communicate via smoke signals were intended to pass messages rapidly along the wall's vast length.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]In pure military terms, the Great Wall turned out to be something of a failure. The Manchus were able to bribe a Chinese general to let them pass through the wall, so it turned out to be of little value in stopping a major barbarian attack. After the Manchus conquered China, the borders of the country extended far to the north, rendering the wall irrelevant. The sheer monetary cost of the wall was also staggering, and the cost in human lives is said to have exceeded over one million souls. The Great Wall is sometimes nicknamed "the long graveyard."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Today much of the Great Wall is in a state of disrepair - though the tourist regions are well-preserved, much of the rest of the structure is crumbling, and perhaps only 20% of the wall is in good condition. Despite its decay, the Great Wall remains one of China's most popular tourist attractions and a true wonder of the world.
TXT_KEY_UNIT_ROMAN_BALLISTA_STRATEGY: Roman unique unit, more powerful than the Catapult it replaces. The Ballista is an excellent siege weapon. It is extremely useful against cities, but it is quite vulnerable to attack. Be sure to protect the Ballista with other military units. The Ballista must first "set up" (1 MP) before attacking.
TXT_KEY_WONDER_GREATLIGHTHOUSE_QUOTE: [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"They that go down to the sea in ships, that do business in great waters; these see the works of the Lord, and his wonders in the deep."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - The Bible, Psalms 107:23-24[NEWLINE][TAB]
TXT_KEY_WONDER_GREATLIGHTHOUSE_DESC: The Great Lighthouse, also known as the Pharos, was a marble watchtower and lighthouse built in 280 BC on an island in the harbor of Alexandria, Egypt. Estimated to have been 300 feet high, the primary function of the lighthouse was to guide approaching ships to the harbor on an otherwise unmarked coast. Exactly how the Pharos functioned is open to debate, with some historians believing that fires were burned on the top of the tower, while others believe that mirrors were used to reflect sunlight. (Since ships rarely sailed along coasts at night, there was probably little need for the lighthouse after dark.) The Pharos was destroyed in the 14th century after having been damaged by earthquakes.
TXT_KEY_WONDER_GREATLIBRARY_DESC: The Great Library of Alexandria was one of the two most important libraries of the ancient world. Ptolemy I founded it around 300 BC, and the Library was enhanced and expanded by his successors. The Library attempted to obtain copies of all scrolls of any consequence, and eventually contained over 700,000 volumes. Religious fanatics destroyed the library in 391 AD, after nearly 700 years of operation. Today, only a portion of the catalog survives, providing us with a mere hint of what treasures the library contained.
TXT_KEY_WONDER_FORBIDDEN_PALACE_HELP: Requires Patronage. Grants 2 additional Delegates in the World Congress. -10% [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness from [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizens in non-occupied Cities.
TXT_KEY_WONDER_FORBIDDENPALACE_QUOTE: [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Most of us can, as we choose, make of this world either a palace or a prison."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - John Lubbock[NEWLINE][TAB]
TXT_KEY_TP_CULTURE_CITY_COST: Each City you own will increase Social Policy costs by {1_Num}%.
TXT_KEY_WONDER_EIFFELTOWER_DESC: The Eiffel Tower is one of the world's most famous landmarks. Built for the Universal Exposition of 1889, the tower rises 984 feet above Paris' Champ de Mars, near the Seine River. Structural engineer Alexandre Gustave Eiffel built the tower at a cost of more than $1 million to demonstrate how steel and iron could be utilized in the construction of extremely tall buildings. The tallest building in the world when it was originally completed, the Eiffel Tower drew crowds of awestruck observers from around the world. Today, it remains one of Paris' leading tourist attractions.
TXT_KEY_WONDER_CRISTO_REDENTOR_HELP: [ICON_CULTURE] Culture cost of adopting new Policies reduced by 10%.
TXT_KEY_CONFIRM_WAR: Are you sure you want to declare war?
TXT_KEY_OVERWRITE_TXT: This will overwrite your current save file. Are you sure you want to do this?
TXT_KEY_CONCEPT_RELIGION_UNITS_ADVISOR_Q: Do units play a role in Religion?
TXT_KEY_WONDER_CRISTOREDENTOR_QUOTE: [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Come to me, all who labor and are heavy burdened, and I will give you rest."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - The Bible, Matthew 25:28[NEWLINE][TAB]
TXT_KEY_WONDER_CRISTOREDENTOR_DESC: Cristo Redentor, "Christ the Redeemer" in English, is a 125-foot tall statue of Jesus Christ situated on Corcovado Mountain, watching over the Brazilian city of Rio de Janeiro. First proposed in 1921 during celebrations of the centennial of Brazilian independence, by 1931 the statue had been completed, making it the largest art deco monument in the world. Since that time, the statue, seated 2330 feet above sea level, has become a beloved symbol of Rio de Janeiro and of Brazil.
TXT_KEY_WONDER_COLOSSUS_QUOTE: [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Why man, he doth bestride the narrow world like a colossus; and we petty men walk under his huge legs, and peep about to find ourselves dishonorable graves."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - William Shakespeare: Julius Caesar[NEWLINE][TAB]
TXT_KEY_WONDER_CN_TOWER_HELP: Provides a free Broadcast Tower in all cities. +1 [ICON_CITIZEN] Population in each city and +1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness per city.
TXT_KEY_POLYNESIAN_SCENARIO_LEADER_GANDH: Samoa is poor; you are rich. Perhaps your considerable karmic burden could be eased by giving this to us.
TXT_KEY_LEADER_NEBUCHADNEZZAR_TRIBUTE_YE: Here. I am nothing but the nightmare of a mad god – what good are such things to me?
TXT_KEY_NOTIFICATION_MINOR_NOW_FRIENDS_M: As a [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Militaristic[ENDCOLOR] City-State, they will occasionally give you military Units.
TXT_KEY_WONDER_CHICHEN_ITZA_HELP: Requires Liberty. Tile improvement construction speed increased by 25% and two Workers appear near the City.
TXT_KEY_WONDER_CHICHENITZA_DESC: Chichen Itza is an extraordinary city of stone built in the Yucatan, Mexico. Some of the oldest buildings and pyramids date back to 1500 years ago and are of Toltec and Mayan origin.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Chichen Itza consists of buildings, temples and courtyards of stone. A large "pok tap ok" or ceremonial ball court stands off to one side. (Ceremonial ball is that most interesting of games in which two sides sought to pass the ball through hoops at each end of the court. The captain of the winning team was then beheaded as a sacrifice to the gods.) Though the city is much ravaged by time (and looters), there still remain many beautiful stone carvings and statues.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]At the center of the city stands the mighty stepped pyramid of Kukulcan, also known as "El Castillo." Constructed around the 13th century, El Castillo is approximately 180 feet square at the base and 78 feet in height. As was the Mayan practice, Kukulcan was constructed atop an older and smaller pyramid.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Chichen Itza was a thriving city until the 13th century, when revolt and civil war broke out among the Mayans, at which point the city went into a steep decline from which it never recovered. The center of the city was largely abandoned and in ruins by the time of the Spanish Conquest of the Yucatan in the 16th century.
TXT_KEY_CONGRESS_UN_HEADING2_BODY: Once half of the civilizations reach the Atomic Era (or one civilization reaches the Information Era), the World Congress becomes the United Nations. This unlocks the Elect World Leader resolution, the winner of which will achieve a Diplomatic Victory.
TXT_KEY_WONDER_BROADWAY_HELP: 1 free Great Musician appears near the City where the Wonder was built. Contains 3 slots for Great Works of Music.
TXT_KEY_WONDER_BRANDENBURGGATE_QUOTE: [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Pale Death beats equally at the poor man's gate and at the palaces of kings."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Horace[NEWLINE][TAB]
TXT_KEY_WONDER_BRANDENBURGGATE_DESC: The Brandenburg Gate is the only surviving town gate of the city of Berlin. A beautiful "triumphal arch" constructed in the Greek style in 1788-91, it features many columns and is surmounted by the "Quadriga of Victory," a statue of a chariot drawn by four horses. It stands at the end of the avenue Unter den Linden.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]After World War II, Berlin was partitioned between sections controlled by the Soviet Union and its allies and the United States and its allies, and the Berlin Wall was constructed by the Soviets to keep the two parts of the city separated. The Brandenburg Gate was in a sort of a "no-man's land" between the two factions, and from 1961-1989 neither side had access. The Gate was reopened in 1989 as part of the reunification of Berlin and Germany.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Today it stands as a proud symbol of the reunified city and country, and it is visited by tens of thousands of tourists from both east and west.
TXT_KEY_WONDER_BIG_BEN_HELP: Requires Commerce. Cost of [ICON_GOLD] Gold purchasing in all cities reduced by 15%.
TXT_KEY_WONDER_BIGBEN_DESC: Big Ben is the clock (and the clock tower) at the northern end of the Houses of Parliament in London, England. Big Ben (the clock) is famous for its accuracy and for its massive bell which weighs more than 13 tons and tolls out the day's hours.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Big Ben was designed by Lord Edmund Grimthorpe and constructed by Edward Dent and his son, Frederick. The clock and bell were installed in the tower in 1859. Big Ben is the second largest four-faced clock in the world. At the base of each face of the clock is the Latin inscription, "Oh Lord, keep safe our Queen Victoria the First."
TXT_KEY_WONDER_ANGKOR_WAT_HELP: [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and [ICON_GOLD] Gold costs of acquiring new tiles reduced by 25% in every city.
TXT_KEY_WONDER_ALHAMBRA_QUOTE: [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Justice is an unassailable fortress, built on the brow of a mountain which cannot be overthrown by the violence of torrents, nor demolished by the force of armies."[NEWLINE]- Joseph Addison[NEWLINE][TAB]
TXT_KEY_WONDER_ALHAMBRA_DESC: Found in southern Spain, the Alhambra is a large palace complex of the Nasrid Dynasty, who controlled the region in the mid 14th century. Construction first began sometime around 1238 AD under the rule of Ibn al-Ahmar, and continued under his successors. Taking its name from the red hue of its walls, the name Alhambra is translated as the "Red Fortress." Noted for its Moorish Islamic architectural style, the Alhambra features elaborate engravings and numerous examples of the interlacing patterns known as "Arabesques" found predominately in Islamic art. Although many examples of the original Islamic style remain today, much of the palace and its interior was reconstructed and modified after the rise of Catholicism in Spain.
TXT_KEY_NOTIFICATION_YOU_LOST_CAPITAL_YO: You lost your original [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital City! You control the most original [ICON_CAPITAL] Capitals. ({1_Num})
TXT_KEY_CIV5_DAWN_AZTECS_TEXT: Welcome, oh Divine Montezuma! We grovel in awe at your magnificence! May the heavens shower all manner of good things upon you all the days of your life! You are the leader of the mighty Aztec people, wandering nomads from a lost home in the north who in the 12th century came to live in the Mesa Central in the heart of what would come to be called Mexico. Surrounded by many tribes fighting to control the rich lands surrounding the sacred lakes of Texcoco, Xaltocan and Zumpango, through cunning alliances and martial prowess, within a mere two hundred years the Aztecs came to dominate the Central American basin, ruling a mighty empire stretching from sea to sea. The empire at last fell under assault from foreign devils - the cursed Spaniards! - wielding fiendish weapons the likes of which your faithful warriors had never seen.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Oh Great King Montezuma! Your people call upon you once more to rise up and lead them to glory! Bring them wealth and power, and give them dominion over their foes and rivals! Will you answer their call, Glorious Leader? Will you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
TXT_KEY_WE_BULLIED_YOUR_MINOR_1: It's come to my attention that I may have bullied {@1_MinorCivName}, which is under your protection. You do not put their needs above mine, I hope.
TXT_KEY_NEWWORLD_SCENARIO_LEADER_WILLIAM: Can you do a little better?
TXT_KEY_DIPLO_DISCUSS_SORRY_FOR_CLAIMING: Our apologies, we'll refrain from claiming land near you in the future.
TXT_KEY_WE_ATTACKED_YOUR_MINOR_1: It's come to my attention that I may have attacked {@1_MinorCivName}, a city-state under your protection. While it was not my goal to be at odds with your empire, this was deemed a necessary course of action.
TXT_KEY_WASHINGTON_HOSTILE_AGGRESSIVE_MI: The positioning of your forces on our borders is unacceptable. Move them immediately, or else.
TXT_KEY_GENERIC_COOP_WAR_YES_1: That sounds like a wise move. Let us take to the battlefield.
TXT_KEY_WASHINGTON_EXPANSION_SERIOUS_WAR: Your territory is encroaching upon the sovereign lands of the United States. You have been warned for the last time.
TXT_KEY_WAR_DEMAND_REFUSED_1: So be it. My armies will extract it from your lands then.
TXT_KEY_WAR_CSTATE_TT: You are at war with {1_CityStateName:textkey}. Unless they are allied with another player you are at war with, you may make peace at any time. While at war, your [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence is locked at -60.
TXT_KEY_WARMONGER_PREVIEW_MINOR: You will receive a [COLOR_YELLOW]MINOR[ENDCOLOR] Warmonger penalty if you capture this city.
TXT_KEY_MAP_OPTION_GLOBAL_CLIMATE_HELP: A standard climate, as if the map represents a whole world.
TXT_KEY_LEADER_CASIMIR_DEFEATED_2: Today you are the victor…I hope you will lead my people with honor.
TXT_KEY_LEADER_MONTEZUMA_TRADEREQUEST_AN: Accept the terms of this agreement or your people will suffer!
TXT_KEY_LEADER_MARIA_FIRSTGREETING_2: So, you are the one who has been loafing about my court.  I suppose I should welcome you to Austria, but I don't believe you'll be staying here all that long.
TXT_KEY_LEADER_RAMKHAMHAENG_TRADE_NEEDMO: You must do better than that.
TXT_KEY_CIVIL_WAR_SCENARIO_PROMOTION_EWE: [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+10 HP per turn outside of friendly and enemy territory.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Led the Confederate advance into Pennsylvania and nearly captured Harrisburg during the Gettysburg campaign.
TXT_KEY_CIV5_INDIA_TEXT_12: In 1757, the British East India Company's army fought the forces of the Nawab of Bengal, who was angry at the company's refusal to pay taxes. The Company's army was victorious, and the victors occupied Bengal, the first of many cities and provinces it would conquer in the name of "free trade." Over the next century the Company expanded its rule, taking advantage of the fractured Indian landscape of small, weak kingdoms and princely states. The British used bribery, threats and military means to expand their power, and by 1850 they controlled most of the sub-continent.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]In 1857 the Indians rebelled against the British. This rebellion is variously called "The Indian Mutiny" or the "First War of Independence." While the rebellion enjoyed initial success the British Army sent in large numbers of troops to reinforce the Company's beleaguered forces; these professional soldiers quickly defeated the rebellious Indians. Following the rebellion the British Crown took over governance of India from the British East India Company. India would remain the "Jewel" of the British Crown for the next ninety years.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]While the British Empire profited greatly from its domination of India, British rule was not entirely without benefit to the Indian people. The Brits educated the Indians, bringing them into contact with more advanced European science and technology. They constructed a solid network of telegraph lines, roads and railroads across the country. They also united the Indian people against them, giving everyone an equally-detested common enemy. It is this last effect that made an Indian independence movement possible.
TXT_KEY_NOTIFICATION_YOU_DENOUNCE: You have publicly denounced {1_CivName:textkey}, warning the world they are not to be trusted!
TXT_KEY_SCRAMBLE_AFRICA_ALLY_GAINED: Military units from the city state of {1_CityStateName} have joined your army!
TXT_KEY_VP_DIPLO_MY_VOTES_COL_TT_ALT: The number of votes that each player is projected to receive in the next UN election.  The actual votes may differ depending on gameplay events that take place between now and the election.
TXT_KEY_NEWWORLD_SCENARIO_LEADER_PACAL_T: The scourge of the ancestors be upon you!  You have angered the gods with your impudence. Leave!
TXT_KEY_VP_DOMINATION_PROGRESS: Players which possess their original capital:
TXT_KEY_MEDIEVAL_SCENARIO_OTHER_CARAVEL: {@1_PlayerName} has sent an expedition off to the New World! For this feat of exploration they received {2_VPAmount} Victory Points. {3_NumRemaining} more expedition(s) may receive exploration VP.
TXT_KEY_GENERIC_GREETING_AGGRESSIVE_MILI: The positioning of your military is somewhat worrisome. I advise you to withdraw for the sake of future peace. Now, what would you like to talk about?
TXT_KEY_LEADER_KAMEHAMEHA_TRIBUTE_NO_ANG: The Kahunas would ask for my head were I to agree to these demands.
TXT_KEY_ADVISOR_WORKERS_PROTECT_BODY: Workers are defenseless, so use extreme caution when moving them outside our borders. Since we only have one city at the moment, we should [COLOR_ADVISOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]keep our Workers within our territory[/COLOR].
TXT_KEY_MEDIEVAL_SCENARIO_CIV5_DAWN_TEXT: SCENARIO DESCRIPTION[NEWLINE]The Great Schism has divided the Christian church into east and west. All attempts to reconcile Byzantium and Rome have failed. Meanwhile the Islamic armies of the Great Turk threaten Constantinople with capture. In response, Pope Urban II issues a call for a crusade to bolster the Byzantines and liberate the Holy Land. The stage is set for a dramatic battle between the faiths. With such bloodshed on the horizon, will you be able to preserve civilization as we know it and lead the world into the glory of the Renaissance?[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]VICTORY CONDITIONS[NEWLINE]Victory is awarded based on score after 200 turns. Earn special scenario VP as follows:[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Holy City Control: Control (or be allied with) the Holy City for your religion or Jerusalem (10 VP per turn).[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Holy Roman Emperor: Win the election by receiving the most votes from all powers and City-States (250 VP per election).[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]New World: Send Caravels west after researching Exploration.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Religious War: Capture cities following a different religion.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]SPECIAL RULES[NEWLINE]Three religions are established before the game starts: Catholicism (Holy City is Vatican City), Orthodoxy (Holy City is Constantinople) and Islam (Holy City is Mecca). Control your Holy City (or Jerusalem) to gain the benefits of the Founder beliefs for your religion.
TXT_KEY_VP_DIPLO_UN_INACTIVE: The United Nations has not yet begun.
TXT_KEY_CIV5_SAMARKAND_TEXT: Samarkand is one of the oldest cities in the world, located in the region of Central Asia known as Transoxiana. Built in the fertile Zerafshan River valley, Samarkand had the benefit of abundant natural resources and food; more significantly, it sat astride the Silk Road, the main trade route between the Orient and the West. Founded c. 700 BC by the Sogdians, by the time Alexander the Great conquered it in 329 BC Samarkand was one of the world's richest and most important cities.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The city remained a mercantile power for centuries after, growing ever richer on taxes imposed on caravans along the Silk Road; it also served as a conduit for culture and innovations between the East and the West. Legend has it that the secret of papermaking was obtained from two Chinese prisoners by the Muslims around 751 AD, which led to the creation of the first paper mill in the Islamic world in Samarkand. From there the knowledge of linen paper spread throughout the Muslim lands, and onward to Europe.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Marco Polo, in his account of his journey along the Silk Road to China, described Samarkand as "a very large and splendid city." In 1370, Tamerlane, founder of the Timurid Empire, made Samarkand his capital. During the next 35 years, he rebuilt, several times over, the city, populating it with skilled artisans, craftsmen, merchants and scholars from across the empire, making it the cultural and commercial center of all Central Asia.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]But the opening of sea trade routes between the Orient and Europe, and the exploitation of the newly-discovered Americas, made it a backwater. The population declined precipitously, and for a period it was uninhabited. Only after it became a provincial capital in the expanding Russian Empire in 1887 did Samarkand became an important economic center again.
TXT_KEY_UNIT_SHOSHONE_COMANCHE_RIDERS_ST: The Comanche Riders replaces the Cavalry, and only the Shoshone may build it. Cheaper and faster than the base unit.
TXT_KEY_VP_DIPLO_TT_YOU_NO_CAPITAL: You have not built a Capital city.
TXT_KEY_MISSION_PILLAGE_HELP: An improvement or route in this tile may not be used until repaired. Pillaging an improvement will earn [ICON_GOLD] Gold and heal your unit by 25 points.
TXT_KEY_VP_DIPLO_TT_YOU_CONTROL_OTHER_PL: You control {1_CityName}, the original [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital of {2_CivName}.
TXT_KEY_CIV5_IMPROVEMENTS_CITADEL_TEXT: A Citadel is a mighty fortification that can only be constructed by a Great General, usually near a city or on a particularly defensible piece of terrain. The Acropolis in Athens, Greece, is an example of an early powerful Citadel. Such structures were almost impossible to take by direct attack, and they were capable of withstanding protracted sieges before they fell. You can construct a Citadel anywhere within your territory, or directly adjacent to your territory. Upon constructing the Citadel, your Culture borders will also expand to surround the Citadel on all sides by one hex. If the new Culture border claims hexes already owned by another civilization, you will incur a diplomatic penalty as a result. Any unit stationed within a Citadel receives a 100% defensive strength bonus. Additionally, any enemy unit which ends its turn next to a Citadel takes 30 damage (damage does not stack with other Citadels).
TXT_KEY_LEADER_HARALD_FIRSTGREETING_1: Greetings, stranger! I am Harald Bluetooth, ruler of the Danes. Do you like my Longship?  It has crushed a thousand of my enemies.
TXT_KEY_VP_DIPLO_TT_UNMET_CONTROLS_THEIR: An unmet civilization controls their original [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital.
TXT_KEY_RESOURCE_NUTMEG_HELP: Appears as a unique luxury good in an Indonesian city.
TXT_KEY_OPSCREEN_TURNS_FOR_AUTOSAVES_TT: How often the game automatically saves the game.
TXT_KEY_SOCIALPOLICY_GAINING_ADV_QUEST: How do you gain social policies?
TXT_KEY_LEADER_ODA_ATTACKED_3: You bloated idiot! Now you must be destroyed.
TXT_KEY_BELIEF_ITINERANT_PREACHERS: Religion spreads to cities 30% further away
TXT_KEY_VP_DIPLO_TT_KNOWN_NO_CAPITAL: {1_PlayerName} has not built a Capital city.
TXT_KEY_BUILDING_TURKISH_BATH_STRATEGY: The Turkish Bath is the Ottoman unique building. Like a stock exchange the Turkish Bath increases the city's wealth. However, the Turkish Bath also increases the amount of [ICON_GOLD] Gold a city generates. Trade routes other players make to a city with a Market will generate an extra 2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for the city owner and the trade route owner gains an additional 1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for the trade route. The city must have a Bank before the Turkish Bath may be constructed.
TXT_KEY_FINANCESTRATEGY_MAKING_MONEY_UNI: We are making money! Our current greatest expense is unit maintenance, costing us {1_Num} [ICON_GOLD]gold a turn. Consider deleting any obsolete or unnecessary units if you want to turn an even greater profit.
TXT_KEY_BELIEF_RELIGIOUS_TEXTS: Religion spreads 25% faster (50% with Printing Press)
TXT_KEY_CIV5_INDONESIA_TEXT_7: Dutch rule collapsed in the face of Japanese invasion and occupation in 1942 AD. The events of World War II fanned the flames of nationalism that had arisen in the country in the previous four decades. The first nationalist movement, the Budi Utomo, had coalesced as early as 1908; the first Indonesian political party, Sarekat Islam, was founded in 1912. The latter was followed by the Indies Social Democratic Association, which would evolve into the Communist Party of Indonesia in 1924. Finally, in July 1927, the pro-independence Partai Nasional Indonesia was formed by Sukarno (who would become Indonesia's first president) and other liberals. Following an abortive revolt led by the Communists, Sukarno and most other nationalist leaders were arrested.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]In July 1942, Sukarno accepted Japan's offer to rally public support for the Japanese war effort. Japan's occupation was often brutal, with torture and forced labor in some instances; but many of the nationalists continued to cooperate in hopes of attaining their goal of independence promised by the Japanese administrators. In March 1945, in the face of a military defeat, Japan announced the formation of a committee to institute Indonesian independence. But events overtook the committee. Two days after the Japanese surrender to Allied forces, Sukarno unilaterally declared Indonesia free of colonial rule. The Netherlands, initially backed by Great Britain, attempted to re-establish their domination and a bitter armed and diplomatic struggle ensured. The fight did not end until the Dutch, in the face of growing international pressure, formally recognized Indonesian independence.
TXT_KEY_CIV5_BUILDINGS_ANALYTICAL_ENGINE: Towering above a mere Difference Engine, the Analytical Engine acts as the logistical brain of an empire.  It is tended by a staff of specialists, and its valuable operation time is carefully budgeted.
TXT_KEY_CIVIL_WAR_SCENARIO_UNIT_UNION_CA: The basic artillery unit of the Civil War. Very effective against nearby units.
TXT_KEY_LEADER_DIDO_TRADE_NEEDMORE_ANGRY: You must do better than that.
TXT_KEY_VP_DIPLO_SELF_VOTES_COL_TT_ALT: In the previous election, the number of votes received from other Civilizations.
TXT_KEY_VP_DIPLO_PROJECT_PLAYERS_COMPLET: {1_NumPlayers} {1_NumPlayers : plural 1?Player has; other?Players have;} completed the {2_apolloProgram}.
TXT_KEY_STEAMPUNK_SCENARIO_CIV_SWEDEN_TE: When the old kingdoms weakened, the growing class of academics and inventors saw the opportunity to create a new kind of nation, one that was founded on principles of reason and embraced scientific advancement.  They found allies in many of the old monarchists, who were looking for a way to preserve their influence, and together they became Vedria.  Their ranks mixed quickly, and before long every prominent leader was expected to be familiar with scientific processes, if not involved in research personally.  Vedria is marked by optimism for the future to come, and its citizens believe that the noble pursuit of science is the clear path towards it.  Scientists are consulted on matters of state, and given generous funding for their research.
TXT_KEY_COMMAND_WAKE_HELP: This will wake the unit up so that it can be issued orders. Waking a unit does not remove its fortification bonus.
TXT_KEY_OPSCREEN_TUTORIAL_LEVEL_TT: Amount of advice you receive from your Advisors.
TXT_KEY_LEADER_NAPOLEON_LUXURY_TRADE_1: Ah, it seems that we each have some goods which could benefit the other. Shall we?
TXT_KEY_VP_DIPLO_NEW_CAPITALS_REMAINING: All players are still in control of their original [ICON_CAPITAL] Capitals.
TXT_KEY_BUILDING_BURIAL_TOMB_PEDIA: The Egyptians raised ancestor-worship to heights unmatched before or since, and much of their civilization's wealth and creative energy was expended in the construction of Burial Tombs for deceased relatives. Many such tombs may be found in the Valley of the Kings, across the Nile River from Thebes. These tombs were often stocked with a portion of the wealth of the deceased, making them rich targets for tomb robbers throughout history.
TXT_KEY_CIV5_SPAIN_HEADING_3: Early History: From Cro-Magnons to Celts
TXT_KEY_POLYNESIAN_SCENARIO_TURNSREMAINI: No turn limit in this scenario.
TXT_KEY_POLICY_TEMPLE_OF_THE_GODS_TEXT: Many of the early Mesoamerican kingdoms were animistic theocracies, and the "national" temple was as important as the palace in the capital. The oldest of these "temples of the gods" date to the PreClassic Era (roughly 1800 BC to 200 AD), many of these taking the form of pyramids dedicated to jaguar or serpent deities.
TXT_KEY_NOTIFICATION_SPY_STAGE_COUP_FAIL: {1_CivShortDesc} attempted a coup in {2_CityName} but failed to overthrow the {3_CivAdj} supporters that have an alliance with the city-state.
TXT_KEY_CIV5_BUILDINGS_MONASTERY_TEXT: A monastery is a building or complex of buildings housing monks or nuns - people who have renounced worldly things (wealth, possessions, sex) - and dedicated their lives to prayer and meditation. Generally monasteries are single-sex organizations, or if men and women are present, they're separated by imposing walls. Historically monasteries have been places of higher learning, especially during the Middle Ages where members of religious orders were often the only people outside of the ruling elite who knew how to read and write.
TXT_KEY_CIV5_DAWN_CELTS_TEXT: Eternal glory and praise for you, fierce and vengeful Warrior Queen! In a time dominated by men, you not only secured your throne and sovereign rule, but also successfully defied the power of the Roman Empire.  After suffering terrible punishment and humiliation at the hand of the Roman invaders, you rallied your people in a bloody and terrifying revolt. Legions fell under your chariot wheels and the city of London burned. While in the end the Romans retained ownership of the isles, you alone made Nero consider withdrawing all troops and leaving Briton forever.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Oh sleeping lioness, your people desire that you rise and lead them again in the calling that is your namesake.  Will you meet their challenge on the open field and lead the Celts to everlasting victory? Will you restore your lands and build an empire to stand the test of time?
TXT_KEY_LEADER_SULEIMAN_GREETING_POLITE_: Ah, welcome back. The Ottoman Empire is always happy to entertain her friends.
TXT_KEY_NEWWORLD_SCENARIO_TREASURE_NATUR: A treasure has been found near {@1_NWName}.
TXT_KEY_POLYNESIAN_SCENARIO_BUILDING_OBS: Boosts the  [ICON_RESEARCH] Science output of this city. Does not need to be near a Mountain in this scenario.
TXT_KEY_GREAT_WORK_QUOTE_ABHIJNANASAKUTA:
"Yesterday is but a dream;[NEWLINE]Tomorrow is only a vision.
But Today well lived makes every[NEWLINE]yesterday a dream of happiness;[NEWLINE]and every tomorrow a vision of hope."
TXT_KEY_VP_CULTURE_INFLUENCE_UNMET: You are {1_Num: number #.#}% influential over an unmet civilization.
TXT_KEY_CITIES_CITYCOMBAT_HEADING2_BODY: Cities may be attacked and captured by enemy units. Each city has a "defensive value" which is determined by the city's location, its size, whether any military units are "garrisoned" in that city, and whether defensive buildings such as walls have been constructed in the city. The higher the city's defensive value, the harder it is to capture the city. Unless the city is extremely weak or the attacking unit is extremely strong, it will take multiple units multiple turns to capture a city. See the section on Combat for details on warfare in general.
TXT_KEY_LEADER_AHMAD_ALMANSUR_LOSEWAR_1: Perhaps now we can return to proper diplomatic relations.
TXT_KEY_CIV5_BUILDINGS_EAST_INDIA_TEXT: The various East India Companies were joint-stock ventures chartered by the crown to pursue trade in Asia and the islands around the Indian Ocean. Reaching their height during the 17th and 18th centuries, the various companies maintained their own military forces, established settlements under their administration, undertook explorations, fought wars, collected taxes, and built plantations, mines and roads - all in the pursuit of profit. The most successful of these corporations were the "Honourable" East India Company of Britain (chartered by Queen Elizabeth in 1600 AD), the Dutch East Indies Company (1602) and the French Company of the Indies (1664).
TXT_KEY_GENERIC_INSULT_POPULATION_1: Travelers have told us that your empire's economy is in pretty sad shape. If you beg a little I might give you a hand. Okay, actually I won't.
TXT_KEY_VPUI_TIP_8: Internal Trade Routes can be reliable ways to preserve your economy when Barbarians and aggressive neighbors roam around.
TXT_KEY_PEDIA_PROMOTION_MUST_SET_UP: Must Set Up to Ranged Attack
TXT_KEY_VPUI_TIP_6: Against an aggressive warmonger, value defensive positions over good economic output for your frontier cities. A lost city will grant you no reward.
TXT_KEY_MAP_MESO_HELP: A large map spanning the Nile River valley to the west and extending east down the Tigris and Euphrates.
TXT_KEY_VPUI_TIP_5: To deal with a snowballing civilization, isolate it diplomatically and weaken it one step at a time. Light a thousand fires.
TXT_KEY_GENERIC_WARMONGER_2: It's clear you're a fairly uncivilized brute. I have to warn you, your actions are starting to attract quite a bit of attention.
TXT_KEY_VPUI_TIP_30: Landmarks you build give you Happiness, no matter where you build them. Building a landmark for another civ will give you happiness and a nice relationship boost.
TXT_KEY_VPUI_TIP_29: Farms, Lumber Mills, and the Hunnic Eki gain additional yields when adjacent to two of themselves. Build them in triangle formations to maximize their output.
TXT_KEY_VPUI_TIP_28: Specialists can be locked in Vox Populi by clicking on an empty Specialist slot in the city screen.
TXT_KEY_VPUI_TIP_27: SHIFT+LCLICK on the Next Turn button to issue a skip turn order to all idle Units. This can be used if you're experiencing the glitch that prevents progressing to the next turn.
TXT_KEY_VPUI_TIP_26: When voting for World Congress resolutions, right-click to assign all delegates and middle-click or shift-click to assign ten.
TXT_KEY_VPUI_TIP_25: CTRL+RCLICK issues a 'Move and Act' order. Workers repair tiles and improve resources, Missionaries spread their religion, Diplomatic Units spread influence, Archaeologists dig, and Combat Units go into Fortify or Alert mode.
TXT_KEY_VPUI_TIP_24: Issue move orders with SHIFT+RCLICK to create waypoints.
TXT_KEY_VPUI_TIP_23: When you expend a Great Writer, make sure you do it in a city where you want to grab new tiles from border growth.
TXT_KEY_CITIES_ANNEXINGCITY_ADV_QUEST: What does it mean to annex a city?
TXT_KEY_VPUI_TIP_20: In each city, Unhappiness from Needs is increased with the number of non-puppeted cities you own, via the Empire Modifier. Don't expand your empire without sizable surplus happiness.
TXT_KEY_BARBARIAN_DESTROYING_ADV_QUEST: What do you get if you destroy a barbarian encampment?
TXT_KEY_VPUI_TIP_2: Local Unhappiness from Needs cannot exceed a city's Population.
TXT_KEY_LEADER_MARIA_I_WINWAR_2: How glorious a day! Perhaps you will learn not to underestimate the power of a queen!
TXT_KEY_VPUI_TIP_18: For each 1 damage taken, Units lose 0.3% Combat Strength when attacking (or defending against melee attacks). Soften your enemy's units with ranged attacks before attacking with your melee units.
TXT_KEY_RECOMMEND_SETTLER_GOLD: This location will produce a city with a high output of [ICON_GOLD] Gold, increasing our national treasury!
TXT_KEY_SP_MAP_PACK_BERING_DESC: The Bering Strait and lands surrounding, including the Russian Far East, Kamchatka, and Alaska.
TXT_KEY_VPUI_TIP_14: Combat Strength allows you to win battles. Healing allows you to win wars.
TXT_KEY_VPUI_TIP_13: Offense is often the best defense, particularly against warmongers whose power spikes later in the game.
TXT_KEY_CIV5_IMPROVEMENTS_ARCHAEOLOGICAL: An Archaeological Dig can only be constructed by an Archaeologist at an Antiquity Site resource. The excavations at the ancient city of Troy are an example of a preeminent archaeological dig site. Upon constructing the Dig, your Archaeologist will discover what type of Artifact is buried at this location. You can then choose to either have the Archaeologist create a permanent Landmark improvement here, or extract the Artifact for placement in a Great Work of Art slot in a building in your empire.
TXT_KEY_VPUI_TIP_12: Even if you aren't aiming for a Diplomatic Victory, City-State Embassies will prevent you from being left at the mercy of more influential civilizations after the World Congress is founded.
TXT_KEY_VPUI_TIP_11: Founding a religion isn't crucial if you know you can take the Holy City of your neighbor.
TXT_KEY_NOTIFICATION_TURN_MODE_SIMULTANE: Your war with a human player has ended. Your turns will be played simultaneously with all non-warring civilizations.
TXT_KEY_LEADER_NEBUCHADNEZZAR_ATTACKED_2: We shall destroy you, you know.  Do you care for some cheese?
TXT_KEY_VPUI_TIP_10: Recon units are most vulnerable near coastal or mountainous tiles, where Barbarians can often surprise and trap them.
TXT_KEY_NEWWORLD_SCENARIO_CIV5_WENDAT_TE: The Wendats are some of the indigenous people of Canada, primarily living on the north shore of Lake Ontario at the time of European contact.
TXT_KEY_VPUI_TIP_1: Great Person yields are determined at the moment they are created.
TXT_KEY_VIKING_SCENARIO_CITYSTATE_SCOTLA: There have been people living in the north of Britain since the end of the last ice age, about 8,500 years before the Romans recorded works on the island. Neolithic ruins in Scotland predate the famous Skara Brae of the Orkneys, and archeological evidence reveals evidence of warring communities living in fortified villages through the Iron Age.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The Caledonians fought hard and often successfully against the Romans in Britain, forcing them to retreat from their tentative forts and outposts behind Hadrian's Wall. The land was occupied by the Picts and Britons thereafter, until the Dark Ages, when the Irish, Anglo-Saxons, and then Vikings invaded and created permanent settlements in Scotland. Saint Ninian's mission brought Christianity to the region around 450 AD, although apparently the Picts then renounced it until Saint Columba arrived in 563.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Legend has it that the Picts were betrayed by the Scots king Kenneth Mac Alpin, who invited the Pictish king Drest and his nobles to a feast, plied them with drink, and then pulled the pins from their benches, sending them into spikey pits concealed beneath.  The truth is somewhat less fanciful - Mac Alpin had claim to the crown of both kingdoms, and managed to combine them into what would become the Kingdom of Alba.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The Kingdom of Alba became the core of what is recognized as Scotland. Through conquest and expansion, the kingdom of Strathclyde was added, and the southern barrier pushed to the River Tweed - the modern-day Southeastern border of Scotland.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]King Duncan led an expedition to try to seize the lands of his rival Macbeth around 1039. The expedition was a terminal disaster for Duncan, who was killed in battle, and Macbeth then became the king of the Scots. It should be noted that the conflict between Macbeth and Duncan was the basis for Shakespeare's play, and is historically accurate if you ignore such simple details as the age of both Duncan and Macbeth, the stated relationship between the two men, and the entire chronology given in  the play. Duncan's son Malcolm did follow Macbeth as king of Scotland, so at least he got that part right. And as King James was Shakespeare's patron, a colorful reinterpretation of history that flattered the man paying the bills is perhaps understandable.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]When William the Conquerer invaded Britain, Edgar the Aethling sought refuge in Scotland with an eye to claiming his kingship to the south, but by 1072 William had successfully invaded Scotland and forced Malcolm (who had become king in 1057) to pay him tribute and hostages.
TXT_KEY_VIKING_SCENARIO_CITYSTATE_POWYS_: The Roman Empire marked out a territory in Britain between the Cambrian Mountains and Western Midlands, and built a capital at the site of modern Wroxeter called Viroconium Cornoviorum. As Roman power in Britain faded in the Dark Ages, a new state arose in the traditional lands of the Ordovices and Cornoviis, extending from the Cambrian Mountains to the Western Midlands. By the middle of the 5th Century AD, Powys was solidly established as a kingdom of Britain.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The first and greatest ruling house of Powys was the Gwerthrynion, who claimed the legendary Vortigern as their founder. The historical warlord Vortigern would later become the model for the literary King Arthur, and the literary embellishment of Arthur has done something to mythologize the kingdom of Powys as well.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Early in the 6th Century, Powys was ravaged by the Northumbrians and portions annexed by their erstwhile allies the Mercians, but Powys stormed back, conquering territory from the English until by mutual agreement a border was established at Offa's Dyke in the middle of the 7th Century. Offa's Dyke remains today the border between Wales and England.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Powys was eventually subsumed by the Kingdom of Gwynedd on the death of the last Gwerthyrnion king in 855. When Howell the Good became king of Gwynedd in 942, he already ruled most of the lands that make up modern Wales. Through savvy politicking and legal reforms, he made his kingdoms into great powers on the island, codifying Welsh Law and creating the first indigenous Welsh coin since the Bronze Age. On Howell's death, Powys was given to one of his sons, but the greater Welsh kingdom was reassembled by his grandson Maredudd ab Owain.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Over time, the power of the great Welsh families waned, and invaders from Ireland and the Vikings chipped away at the throne of Powys, as usurpers seized the throne and were overthrown by pretenders of the old houses. By the time of the Norman Invasion, constant fractious warfare wracked the land, and William the Conquerer was content to leave Wales to his barons to deal with. They in turn made a complete hash of it.
TXT_KEY_BARBARIAN_POINTLIMITS_HEADING3_B: When they fight barbarian units, your less well-trained units will gain experience points. However, any unit that has already acquired 30 XPs (or has exchanged that many for promotions) no longer gains XPs from fighting barbarians.
TXT_KEY_VIKING_SCENARIO_CITYSTATE_NORTHU: The adjoining kingdoms of Deira and Bernecia were united by force when King Aethelfrith of Bernicia conquered Deira in 604. But this victory was short-lived, and when Aethelfrith was killed in 616, the son of the former king of Deira, Edwin, was made king of the combined lands. But it was not until the rule of King Oswald in 634 that Northumbria was finally consolidated into a single Anglian kingdom. Oswald quickly expanded his kingdom and Christianized it with the help of Saint Aidan of Iona.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Northumbria was often at war with Mercia. Oswald was killed in battle with the Mercians in 650, and the Picts rose up and defeated the Northumbrians in 685. A brief period of stability under the reign of Aldfrith followed, but Northumbria had lost its prestige and power, and was conquered by the Danish brothers Halfdan Ragnarsson and the colorfully-named Ivar the Boneless.  A brief uprising by Aella of Northumberland was brutally suppressed. Now subject to the Danelaw, a series of puppet kings ruled Northumberland until Erik Bloodaxe in 954. From then on, Northumberland was no kingdom, but a mere Earldom.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]William the Conquerer quickly set his eyes on Northumbria, recognizing it as a valuable buffer against the North, and as a symbol to resistance to his rule. He attempted to install one of his barons as an overlord, but the baron and 700 of his retainers were slaughtered in the city of Durham. This led William to conduct a punitive campaign into Northumbria, partitioning it into an Earldom seated in Durham, and the region of Northumberland. The Normans built the city of Newcastle to secure their hold on this new territory of theirs, but the hold was tentative. The lands of Northumbria were long afterwards a fractious border country, rebelling against rule from the south and fighting the protracted border war with the Scots to the North.
TXT_KEY_VIKING_SCENARIO_CITYSTATE_MEATH_: For 1000 years, Mide, or Meath, was the central Kingdom of Ireland, both geographically and spiritually. Tradition dates the founding of Meath to the First Century AD, by Tuathal Techtmar, ancestor of the great Niall of the Nine Hostages.  Tuathal carved himself a kingdom from territory seized from Ulster, Leinster, Connacht, and Munster and named the resulting territory Meath. The Ui Neill kings of the South were the traditional rulers of Meath.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Meath's importance to the High Kings of Ireland was further enhanced because the Hill of Tara was situated there. The Hill of Tara is a complex of barrows and earthworks dating back to the Iron Age, and traditionally the place where the High King was crowned. The Hill of Tara has been used as a ritual location since the Neolithic, and was the spiritual heart of Ireland until the 12th Century, though its importance declined with the ascension of the British and the expansion of Christianity.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Whether or not the Irish High Kings sat in court on the Hill of Tara or not, Meath's central location in Ireland and its proximity to the Norse Irish settlements made it a kingdom of great importance. The Battle of Clontarf was fought on its soil, where the last great High King of Ireland, Brian Boru, fell.
TXT_KEY_LEADER_CASIMIR_WARBLUFF_1: You are playing a dangerous game.
TXT_KEY_VIKING_SCENARIO_CITYSTATE_GALLOW: At the tip of Southwestern Scotland is the Gall-Ghaidhealaibh - the land of the foreign Gaels. Isolated by its rugged coastline and hilly northern border, it was nonetheless drawn on Ptolemy's map of Britain. The Romans called the inhabitants the Novantae, and the missionary Saint Ninian built a church here, but much of its history is shrouded in legend. The Welsh poets believed that one of King Arthur's Three Thrones of Britain was in Galloway, called Pen Rhionydd.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]At some point in the late 7th century, Galloway was wrestled from control of the Britons by the Kingdom of Bernicia, who displaced the locals from the flat arable land and forced them into the hills. But the remoteness of the region meant it was easy prey for the Vikings and the Irish (especially the Irish Vikings) for whom the territory was just a short hop across the Irish Sea.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The Norse Gaels, the Gall-Gaedhil, are the best-known inhabitants of Galloway. The Norse controlled the Irish Sea, and their settlements dotted its edges. Despite their Gaelic that they shared with the nascent Scots, they were indisputably their own people, sailing from their isolated lands to wreak havoc on the coastlines of Britain. This isolation meant that the Lords of Galloway were effectively kings on their own until late in the Middle Ages, starting with Suibne mac Cináeda in the early 10th century and extending until the 12th. Though nominally under the High King of Scotland, they could ignore or pay tribute to him as their power allowed.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The Law of Galloway lasted another two centuries after their Lords lost power, a tribute to the splendid isolation of the land and people of Galloway.
TXT_KEY_SPECIALISTSANDGP_ART_CREATEGW_AD: How do I create a Great Work?
TXT_KEY_VICTORY_WHOVOTES_HEADING4_BODY_A: Once the World Congress is founded, civilizations express their diplomatic power through the use of delegates. During each session of the World Congress, you assign these delegates to different resolutions that have different gameplay effects. Once the United Nations is founded, delegates are essential to becoming the World Leader and winning Diplomatic Victory.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]See the "World Congress" topic for more detailed information.

TXT_KEY_VICTORY_SCIENCE_HEADING3_BODY: You achieve a science victory by learning the necessary technologies to create all of the pieces of the spaceship, then building the parts and moving them to your current capital (or building them there in the first place). Once all the parts are together you may launch your ship to Alpha Centauri. If it successfully makes it to a new planet before anyone else achieves a victory condition, you win the Science Victory!
TXT_KEY_VICTORY_SCIENCE_ADV_QUEST: How does the science victory work?
TXT_KEY_NEWWORLD_SCENARIO_CIV5_ISABELLA_: Isabella
TXT_KEY_VICTORY_LIBERATION_HEADING4_BODY: If you capture a city that belonged to a conquered civilization or city-state, you have the chance to liberate that civilization or city-state, bringing them back into the game. This earns a large amount of admiration from the liberated player which can be leveraged for an attempt to win Diplomatic Victory. For a liberated city-state, you will gain a large amount of influence which goes towards securing them as your ally and gaining more delegates in the World Congress. For a liberated civilization, they will like you much more, and be much more likely to use their delegates to support you for World Leader.

If you take a city-state that has been captured by another civilization, you have the choice to annex the city-state, make it a puppet, or liberate it. If you choose to liberate a city-state, then it will always vote for you in UN elections, no matter what its relations are with you at the time of the vote. If the same city-state has been liberated twice, it will vote for the civ which liberated it most recently.[NEWLINE]If a civilization has been removed from the game and you capture one of those civ's cities, you have the option of annexing it, making it your puppet, or liberating it. If you do so, the civilization returns to play. The liberated civ will always vote for you in UN elections. In case of multiple liberators, the civ will vote for whoever liberated them most recently.

TXT_KEY_VICTORY_HOWTOWIN_HEADING2_BODY: There are five paths to victory available to you in Civilization V:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Domination Victory[NEWLINE]Science Victory[NEWLINE]Cultural Victory[NEWLINE]Diplomatic Victory[NEWLINE]2050 Arrives
TXT_KEY_VICTORY_HOWTOWIN_ADV_QUEST: How can you win the game?
TXT_KEY_LEAGUE_SPLASH_MESSAGE_GAME_ERA: The world has entered the {@1_EraName}, either because half of the Civilizations have reached it or one Civilization has reached the era beyond it.
TXT_KEY_DIPLOMACY_RESOURCES_HEADING3_BOD: You can trade Strategic and Luxury resources with another civ. The other civ gets all of the benefits of the resource for the duration of the trade (30 turns).
TXT_KEY_VICTORY_HEADING1_BODY: There are multiple paths to victory in Civilization V. You can win through scientific dominance, becoming the first civ to create and launch a spaceship to Alpha Centauri. You can overwhelm the other civilizations through cultural superiority or political cunning. Or you can employ the ever-popular "crush all of your enemies beneath the wheels of your chariot" tactic and win a mighty domination victory. Whichever civilization achieves one set of victory conditions first wins.[NEWLINE]It's important to keep an eye on your opponents' progress toward victory as you advance your own civilization. There's nothing so annoying as to be on the verge of capturing your last surviving enemy's final city, only to watch helplessly as he or she completes her spaceship and wins an upset scientific victory.
TXT_KEY_VICTORY_FLAVOR_TECHNOLOGY: You have achieved victory through mastery of Science! You have conquered the mysteries of nature and led your people on a voyage to a brave new world! Your triumph will be remembered as long as the stars burn in the night sky!
TXT_KEY_CIV5_GREECE_TEXT_13: In 334 BC Alexander led an army of 40,000 Greeks across the Hellespont into Persian territory. The details of his extraordinary campaign are described elsewhere in this Civilopedia (see [link]Alexander the Great[end link]); for here suffice it to say that in 10 short years Alexander conquered all of Asia Minor, Persia, Egypt, and parts of Western India. He died at the age of 32 in 323 BC with no heir, leaving his fragmented empire in the hands of his generals and their children.
TXT_KEY_VICTORY_FLAVOR_DOMINATION: The world has been convulsed by war. Many great and powerful civilizations have fallen, but you have survived - and emerged victorious! The world will long remember your glorious triumph!
TXT_KEY_VICTORY_FLAVOR_DIPLOMACY: You have triumphed over your foes through the art of Diplomacy! Your cunning and wisdom have earned you great friends - and divided and sown confusion among your enemies! Forever will you be remembered as the leader who brought peace to a weary world!
TXT_KEY_CIV5_ANTIQUITY_SCOUT_TEXT: Scouts form the eyes and ears of early civilizations. These fleet-footed warriors are not supposed to engage with enemy forces - they're supposed to find the lay of the land, discovering any potential threats or treasures. A civilization that doesn't know what's going on in the world around it is blind to both peril and opportunity.
TXT_KEY_LEADER_ODA_GREETING_HOSTILE_HELL: This samurai grants you an audience. Now speak, and do not waste this opportunity.
TXT_KEY_VICTORY_FLAVOR_CULTURE: You have achieved victory through the awesome power of your Culture. Your civilization's greatness - the magnificence of its monuments and the power of its artists - have astounded the world! Poets will honor you for as long as beauty brings gladness to a weary heart.
TXT_KEY_LEADER_GENGHIS_TRIBUTE_NO_NEUTRA: I find your insane bluster amusing, so I will not kill you for your insolence. Begone.
TXT_KEY_NEWWORLD_SCENARIO_LEADER_PACHACU: Proceed.
TXT_KEY_LEADER_BISMARCK_LUXURY_TRADE_1: Trade is one of many means to strengthen the empire. What do you think of this offer?
TXT_KEY_VICTORY_DOMINATION_HEADING3_BODY: If you are the last player in possession of your own original capital you win. So if you capture all other civs' capitals and hang onto your own, you've achieved victory. However, this can be tricky. Suppose you're in a five-player game and you capture three of your opponents' original capitals, but the fifth player sneaks in and captures your capital while you're not paying attention - then he would win immediately. In other words, it doesn't matter who captures what: it's the last player holding onto his original capital who gets the victory.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]If you've lost your original capital, but still possess other cities, you can still win another type of victory: culture, scientific, diplomatic, or time. However, you cannot win a domination victory until and unless you recapture your own original capital.
TXT_KEY_LEADER_THEODORA_WINWAR_1: I'd say that was quite enjoyable, wouldn't you agree?  I do ever so much love winning.
TXT_KEY_LEADER_CATHERINE_DEMANDTRIBUTE_H: My dear friend, can you spare us the following?
TXT_KEY_VICTORY_DESTROYING_HEADING4_BODY: Can't be done. A capital cannot be destroyed by any means. It can be captured, but not destroyed. Dropping a nuke on the city will at worst reduce its population to 1, but the city will not be destroyed. Accept it and move on. (Remember that you can drive another civ out of the game by destroying or capturing all of its cities, so you can still wipe your foes off the map even if you can't erase their capital from the face of the earth...)

TXT_KEY_GENERIC_ATTACKED_WEAK_HOSTILE_4: So be it. My armies will fight to the death against your wicked forces.

TXT_KEY_LEADER_PEDRO_WINWAR_1: With careful guidance, Brazil's strength shines through all adversity.
TXT_KEY_VICTORY_CAPITAL_HEADING4_BODY: If your original capital has been captured, another of your cities will automatically be assigned as a replacement capital. This city functions in all ways like the original, except that it can be destroyed, and it does not count towards a Domination victory. TXT_KEY_CIV5_BUILDINGS_AETHERIUM_FABRICA: As the mysteries of aetherium continue to be probed, scientists have found ways to make smaller quantities of the resource just as effective as a large quantity, and even craft synthetic versions that approximate its effects.
TXT_KEY_VICTORY_CAPITAL_ADV_QUEST: What happens if a capital is lost? Is another one founded?
TXT_KEY_POLYNESIAN_SCENARIO_POLICY_HULA_: The hula is a type of traditional Hawaiian dance which is accompanied by chants and instrumentation. There are several kinds of related dance across greater Polynesia. Since contact with the West, the instruments and chanting used in the hula have integrated new elements, including polyphonic singing and the ukulele. Hula was performed for a variety of reasons, from highest ritual to simple socialization. The hula dancer's hand motions are used to represent elements in the song, from the undulation of the sea to waving trees, to emotions of the characters. After hula nearly devolved into cultural kitsch, a serious effort to revive the ancient styles of hula began in earnest in Hawaii.
