TXT_KEY_LEADER_DARIUS_TRADE_NEEDMORE_HAP: Is that the best you can do?
TXT_KEY_AGGRESSIVE_MILITARY_WARNING_1: It's come to my attention that you have a large number of Units near my borders. I request that you move them elsewhere to avoid causing undue distress to my citizens.
TXT_KEY_FINANCESTRATEGY_BROKE_AND_GOING_: We are bankrupt and aren't making any money! We need to do everything we can to get out of debt! Our current greatest expense (costing us {1_Num} [ICON_GOLD]gold a turn) is improvement maintenance. We should not build more improvements than we need, and destroy any ones that are not helping us.
TXT_KEY_NOTIFICATION_QUEST_SPREAD_RELIGI: A group of citizens from {@2_MinorCivName} has heard the tenets of {@1_ReligionName} and wants you to spread the religion to their city.  If {@1_ReligionName} becomes the majority religion, your [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence over them will grow.
TXT_KEY_NOTIFICATION_QUEST_KILL_CAMP: The citizens of {1_CivName:textkey} have become uneasy at the presence of a nearby Barbarian Encampment, and they'd like someone to destroy it. They will amply reward whoever accomplishes this.
TXT_KEY_POLYNESIAN_SCENARIO_TP_CULTURE_C: Each city you own does not affect Social Policy costs. So feel free to expand to as many cities as desired.
TXT_KEY_LEADER_GANDHI_TRADE_NO_NEUTRAL: Such an agreement would not be in the best interest of the Indian people.
TXT_KEY_NOTIFICATION_QUEST_GIVEN_CONDENS: New City-State Quests are available.  If you complete a Quest, you will gain [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence with that City-State.  (To see all Quests at a glance, look at the City-States section of the Diplomacy menu.)[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]
TXT_KEY_NOTIFICATION_QUEST_ENDED_REVOKED: Because you demanded tribute from {1_MinorCivName:textkey}, they have revoked quests previously offered to you.  Time must pass before they will freely offer you quests again.
TXT_KEY_NOTIFICATION_QUEST_ENDED_CONTEST: Another civilization has impressed {1_MinorCivName:textkey} with its technological advancement.  Your scientific discoveries were not enough, and your [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence remains the same as before.  Civilizations that succeeded (ties are allowed):[NEWLINE]
TXT_KEY_TECH_TELEGRAPH_DESC: The electric telegraph is the first mechanical device capable of transmitting information rapidly over distances greater than the eye can see. Before the telegraph, the fastest way to pass information between Europe and North America was by clipper ship, which could make the voyage in perhaps 10-20 days, depending upon the weather. After the transatlantic telegraph was introduced, that same information could be transmitted in minutes.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The telegraph required a series of important inventions before it could be implemented. In 1800 Alessandro Volta invented the voltaic cell; in 1820 Hans Christian Orsted of Denmark discovered that a magnetic needle could be deflected by wire carrying electric current; and in 1831 Faraday of Britain and Henry of the US refined the science of electromagnetism sufficiently enough to allow the creation of electromagnetic devices.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]In 1837, American Samuel Morse was granted a patent on an electronic telegraph, while at the same time William Cooke and Charles Wheatstone of Great Britain obtained a British patent on a different telegraph system. By 1844 Morse had a wire strung along the railroad lines between Washington, DC and Baltimore, Maryland. The first message sent was "What hath God Wrought!" Within a few years telegraph lines were strung along most British and American railroads, and they rapidly spread across the entire world. In the 1860s the first transatlantic cables were laid.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The telegraph remained the primary means of long-distance communication for almost a century, until it was replaced by various new inventions including the telephone and radio. During its existence it brought the world together in a way that had never been seen before in the history of mankind. It is arguable that no invention since - including the Internet - has had such an important effect upon human civilization.
TXT_KEY_NOTIFICATION_QUEST_ENDED_CONTEST: Another civilization has impressed {1_MinorCivName:textkey} with its culture.  Your cultural growth was not enough, and your [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence remains the same as before.  Civilizations that succeeded (ties are allowed):[NEWLINE]
TXT_KEY_NOTIFICATION_QUEST_ENDED_CONSTRU: Another player has constructed {@1_WonderName}, meaning you can no longer fulfill the request of {@2_CivName}.
TXT_KEY_CIV5_JAPAN_TEXT_4: The earliest surviving written accounts of Japan are found in China, dating from the Han period of that culture. It stated that in approximately AD 50 the "state of Nu in Wo" sent emissaries to the Later Han court. "Nu" was one of more than 100 states that made up "Wo" (Japan). Chinese court later states that some time after AD 250 a "Queen Himiko" ruled over a confederation of more than 30 states, with a capital at Yamatai. No one is certain where Yamatai was located, and no written Japanese records survive from that period.
TXT_KEY_NOTIFICATION_QUEST_CONTEST_CULTU: The arts are flourishing in {3_MinorCivName:textkey}, and they seek cultural guidance.  Whoever can produce the most [ICON_CULTURE] Culture in a period of {2_TurnsDuration} turns will gain [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence with them.  [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_TurnsRemaining} turns remaining.[ENDCOLOR]
TXT_KEY_BUILDINGS_PALACE_HEADING2_BODY: The palace is a special building. Part building, part Wonder, the palace automatically appears in the first city you build, which makes that city the capital of your empire. If your capital city is captured, your palace will automatically be rebuilt in another city, making that city your new capital. If you subsequently retake your original capital, the palace will move back to its original location.[NEWLINE]The palace provides a small amount of production, science, gold, and culture to your civilization. If you connect other cities to the capital by road or harbor, you will create city connections which generate additional income.
TXT_KEY_CIV5_CELT_PICTISH_WARRIOR_TEXT: The Picts were a Late Iron Age people residing in what is now eastern and northern Scotland, one of the many Celtic tribes of the British Isles. Their warriors were feared not only amongst other Celtic peoples but even by the vaunted Roman legionnaires. The Greek historian Dionysius would write during the reign of Caesar Augustus that their "manner of fighting, being in large measure that of wild beasts and frenzied," brought considerable success against unwieldy military formations operating in the forests and hills of northern Europe.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Adding to their frightful reputation was the use of the carnyx, a bronze trumpet sounded incessantly during battle, both to incite the Picts and intimidate opponents. Finally, firmly in the minds of their opponents were the reports of the severed heads Pictish warriors would carry. Carrying the heads of defeated foes into combat was believed by the Picts to imbue the bearer with courage and perhaps divine wrath.
TXT_KEY_CITY_STATE_HAS_MESSAGE: The City-State of {1_CivName:textkey} has a Message.
TXT_KEY_NOTIFICATION_QUEST_COMPLETE_PLED: Your promise to protect {2_MinorCivName:textkey} has helped them recover from the tribute paid to {1_BullyName:textkey}!  Your [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence over them has increased by [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{3_InfluenceReward}[ENDCOLOR], and they are more resistant to future tribute demands.
TXT_KEY_PROGRESS_SCREEN_HAPPINESS_TT: Ranks players by how [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happy their people are.
TXT_KEY_TECH_CALCULUS_DESC: Calculus is the branch of mathematics based on functions of limits, differentials, derivatives, integrals and infinite series. Calculus provides the mathematician with tools to study areas described by curves and functions. In ancient times, primitive calculus was used to determine the volume and area of geometric forms - how much area is inside a circle of diameter x, for instance, or what is the volume of a cone with a depth of y and a diameter of z? This is an extremely difficult question, and since that time calculus has gotten even moreso.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]In the 17th century Newton and Liebnitz each independently discovered the so-called "fundamental theorem of calculus." It specifies the relationship between the two central operations of calculus: differentiation and integration. This theorem is totally beyond the understanding of this author, who will not even pretend to try to explain it in the Civilopedia.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]However, despite its nightmarish complexity, calculus is extraordinarily useful in physics, chemistry, and economics, and without it modern science would be missing one of its most important tools.
TXT_KEY_NOTIFICATION_QUEST_COMPLETE_GREA: As {2_MinorCivName:textkey} requested, you have successfully created a {1_UnitName}! Their scholars are in awe, and your [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence over them has increased by [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{3_InfluenceReward}[ENDCOLOR].
TXT_KEY_LEADER_AUGUSTUS_DEFEATED_3: The gods have withdrawn their favor from Rome. We are defeated.
TXT_KEY_NOTIFICATION_QUEST_COMPLETE_FIND: Your discovery of {1_TargetName:textkey} has greatly pleased the merchants of {2_MinorCivName:textkey}. Your [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence over them has increased by [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{3_InfluenceReward}[ENDCOLOR].

Your discovery of a new Natural Wonder has inspired the citizens of {1_MinorCivName:textkey}! Because of your efforts, your [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence over them has increased by [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{2_InfluenceReward}[ENDCOLOR].
TXT_KEY_CIVILOPEDIA_LEADERS_AUGUSTUS_TEX: Octavius was born in 63 BC. His father (also named Gaius Octavius) was a respectable but undistinguished member of the equestrian order. His mother, however, was a niece of Julius Caesar. Octavius' father died when he was only four years old, and he was brought up in the house of his stepfather Lucius Marcus Phillippus.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]At the age of fifteen, Octavius put on the toga virilis ("manly robes"), the symbol that he had reached adulthood, and was elected to the College of Pontiffs. In 46 BC he joined Julius Caesar during Caesar's last campaign in Spain. In Spain he made such a fine impression on the great general that Julius Caesar changed his will to make Octavius his heir.
TXT_KEY_NOTIFICATION_QUEST_COMPLETE_BULL: {2_MinorCivName:textkey} enjoyed seeing its rival {1_TargetName:textkey} squirm and give up hard earned resources.  Your [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence over them has increased by [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{3_InfluenceReward}[ENDCOLOR]!
TXT_KEY_NOTIFICATION_POSSIBLE_CITY_REVOL: Because the empire has at least 20 [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness and our public opinion is not Content, a city will revolt in {1_Turns} turns. Based on current Unhappiness levels and pressure from nearby ideologies, the city most likely to revolt is {2_CityName} and it will join {3_CivName}. Try to get your empire's Happiness level out of this range as soon as possible!
TXT_KEY_NOTIFICATION_OVER_RESOURCE_LIMIT: You are currently using more {1_Resource:textkey} than you have! All units which require it will [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]fight much less effectively[ENDCOLOR].
TXT_KEY_NOTIFICATION_OTHER_REGAINED_CAPI: {1_PlayerName} regained their original [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital. You control the most original [ICON_CAPITAL] Capitals. ({2_Num})
TXT_KEY_NOTIFICATION_OTHER_PLAYER_CITY_R: The {1_CivAdjective} city of {2_CityName} has revolted and joined {3_CivName}!
TXT_KEY_NOTIFICATION_OTHER_LOST_CAPITAL_: {1_PlayerName} lost their original [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital. An unmet player controls the most original [ICON_CAPITAL] Capitals. ({2_Num})
TXT_KEY_CIV5_GREECE_HEADING_12: Philip II and Alexander of Macedonia
TXT_KEY_NOTIFICATION_OTHER_LOST_CAPITAL_: {1_PlayerName} lost their original [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital. Team {2_TeamNum} controls the most original [ICON_CAPITAL] Capitals. ({3_Num})
TXT_KEY_NOTIFICATION_NOT_ENOUGH_FAITH_FO: You no longer have enough faith to found a pantheon.
TXT_KEY_NOTIFICATION_NEW_RESEARCH: You may select a new research project.
TXT_KEY_MEDIEVAL_SCENARIO_CITYSTATE_COLO: In 50 AD Rome founded the fortress-city of Colonia on the Rhine to protect the province of Germania Inferior. Prospering under the Romans, and later the Franks, the city became one of the most important trading and religious centers north of the Alps. In 785 it was made the seat of an archbishopric. As part of the Holy Roman Empire, the free city was home to one of the seven prince-electors and three ecclesiastical electors who chose the emperor. Along with one of the grandest cathedrals of the time, the city was also a major harbor and trading center on the Rhine, the site of the charterhouses of a number of influential, self-governing guilds. During the Reformation, the city remained steadfastly Catholic, despite the efforts of two archbishops who converted to Lutheranism. The faculty at the famous university, one of the oldest in Europe, publically burned Luther's works in 1520 AD. Cologne lost its status as a free city in 1798 when occupied by the new French Republic. In 1815 at the Congress of Vienna, it became part of Prussia, and then of Germany after the unification of that nation in 1871. Targeted by the Allies during the Second World War, Cologne endured 262 air raids, which destroyed 95% of the city. It was not until 1959 that Cologne would regain its pre-war population numbers and be fully rebuilt into a modern industrial metropolis.
TXT_KEY_LEADER_SEJONG_TRIBUTE_YES_HAPPY: You had but to ask! A wise man shares his bounty amongst his friends, so that all may prosper.
TXT_KEY_NOTIFICATION_MINOR_WAR_UNIT_HELP: {@1_MinorCivName} is looking for help in their war with {@2_CivName}.  Gifting them units will earn more [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence than normal while the war is underway.  Gifting can be done from a distance, using the City-State's diplomacy screen, or by directly moving a unit into their lands and selecting the appropriate action.
TXT_KEY_NOTIFICATION_MINOR_WAR_QUEST_COM: You have fulfilled {1_CivName:textkey} request to weaken their vile enemy, {2_CivName:textkey}! Your [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence with them has grown.
TXT_KEY_NOTIFICATION_MINOR_WAR_QUEST: {1_CivName:textkey} is under attack from {2_CivName:textkey}! If you don't help them they might be wiped out. They've requested the help of all major powers. If you are able to kill at least {3_NumUnits} enemy Units, {1_CivName:textkey} will be indebted to you.
TXT_KEY_NOTIFICATION_MINOR_WARMONGER_OTH: Because {1_NameKey:textkey} has shown continued aggression, several of the City-States of the world are banding together to fight this common foe! Any military support you can provide would be very welcome. (Click on one of their Cities to give them Units.)
TXT_KEY_NOTIFICATION_MINOR_WARMONGER: Your pattern of preying upon the City-States of the world has caused a great deal of alarm. The alliance to thwart you continues to grow.
TXT_KEY_NOTIFICATION_MINOR_NOW_FRIENDS_R: As a [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Religious[ENDCOLOR] City-State, they share their knowledge of rituals with you! (+{1_NumFaith} [ICON_PEACE] Faith per turn)
TXT_KEY_WONDER_CN_TOWER_DESC: At one time the tallest free-standing structure in the world, the CN Tower of Toronto, Canada still remains among the tallest structures in the world today. Constructed in 1976 as a communications tower by the Canadian National Railway Company (hence the CN moniker), the tower has become a hallmark of Toronto and a major tourist attraction for the city. The tower is still primarily used for television and radio broadcasting, and is now considered one of the "Seven Wonders of the Modern World," joined by several notable constructions of the 20th century.
TXT_KEY_GOLD_PLUNDERED_HEADING3_BODY: If the fiendish barbarians successfully attack one of your cities, they "plunder" some of your gold and you retain the city.
TXT_KEY_NOTIFICATION_MINOR_NOW_FRIENDS_M: As a [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Maritime[ENDCOLOR] City-State, they will export Food to your empire (+{1_NumCapitalFood}[ICON_FOOD]in [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital, +{2_NumCitiesFood}[ICON_FOOD]in all other Cities).
TXT_KEY_SPECIALISTSANDGP_HURRYPRODUCTION: What does the hurry production special ability do?
TXT_KEY_ADVISOR_MOVEMENT_FOREST_BODY: Forests slow down unit movement. Moving into a tile with a forest will often consume all of a unit's movement points. Forests block the view of objects behind them.
TXT_KEY_NOTIFICATION_MINOR_NOW_ALLIES_RE: As a [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Religious[ENDCOLOR] City-State, they give you their most treasured religious relics! (+{1_NumFaith} [ICON_PEACE] Faith per turn)
TXT_KEY_PROMOTION_DEFEND_NEAR_CAPITAL_HE: 30% stronger while fighting in the capital; bonus falls off as the unit gets further away.
TXT_KEY_NOTIFICATION_MINOR_NOW_ALLIES_MA: As a [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Maritime[ENDCOLOR] City-State, they now make large Food exports to your empire (additional +{1_NumCapitalFood}[ICON_FOOD]in [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital, +{2_NumCitiesFood}[ICON_FOOD]in all other Cities).
TXT_KEY_NOTIFICATION_MINOR_NOW_ALLIES_BA: [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence over {3_MinorCivName:textkey} has increased to the point where you have [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Supplanted {1_CivName:textkey} as their ALLY[ENDCOLOR].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]{4_DetailsString}[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]{2_ResourceDetailsString}

[ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence over {2_MinorCivName:textkey} has increased to the point where you are now their [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]ALLY[ENDCOLOR].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]{3_DetailsString}[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]{1_ResourceDetailsString}
TXT_KEY_LEADER_RAMKHAMHAENG_TRADE_NEEDMO: As it stands now, your offer is unfair and would cause me to lose face before my people. Please improve it.
TXT_KEY_NOTIFICATION_MINOR_LOST_ALLIES_M: They will contribute fewer Units to your military.
TXT_KEY_CIV5_ROME_TEXT_11: The mighty Roman Empire is an endlessly fascinating and complex entity. Although long dead, the Empire's shadow still falls across the world, and events in Rome 2000 years ago still affect our daily lives. One wonders if the same will be said about any of today's civilizations.
TXT_KEY_POLYNESIAN_SCENARIO_CIVLOPEDIA_V: As a Western Polynesian island, Vanuatu was among the earliest settled by the Lapita, probably around 4,000 years ago, though the population of the island became largely Melanesian. The first westerner to find Vanuatu was the Portuguese explorer Pedro Fernandes de Queiros, who claimed the land for Spain and named it "Espirtu Santo." De Bougainville visited the island in 1768, and Cook named the island the New Hebrides in 1774.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]As with many Polynesian islands, contact with the west resulted in massive deaths due to new diseases, and a crush of immigrants looking to get rich off the island's Sandalwood trade exacerbated the problems. After sandalwood, speculative plantations for cotton, coffee, cocoa, and bananas were thrown up, until some degree of economic stability was achieved in coconuts.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Colonialism had a heavy hand in Vanuatu until World War II, when the Americans arrived. The affluent, highly informal Americans made a huge impression on the Vanuatans, as did the constant stream of airplanes and ships that supplied the soldiers and sailors. Soon Vanuatans were waiting for the messiah John Frum to arrive with his magical Cargo to deliver the island to liberty and prosperty. The "cargo cult" is alive and well in Vanuatu even today!
TXT_KEY_LEADER_SEJONG_TRADE_NEEDMORE_ANG: You must do better than that.
TXT_KEY_LEADER_DARIUS_TRADE_YES_ANGRY: Did you come up with this idea yourself? How remarkable.
TXT_KEY_NOTIFICATION_MINOR_INTRUSION: You are trespassing in the lands of {1_CivName:textkey}! As long as you have Units in their territory, [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence with them will decrease!
TXT_KEY_GENERIC_RESPONSE_HUMAN_KILLED_MY: It makes me glad that you will overlook this awkward circumstance.
TXT_KEY_NOTIFICATION_MINOR_GAINED_BEST_R: As long as you retain this status they will grant you their [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_ResourceNames}[ENDCOLOR] and all future Resources they connect.
TXT_KEY_NOTIFICATION_INTRIGUE_SNEAK_ATTA: {1_PlayerName} embarked a force to sneak attack {2_CityName}.
TXT_KEY_NOTIFICATION_MINOR_FRIENDSHIP_DE: {1_PlayerName:textkey} has adopted a Social Policy which causes your [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence with City-States to drop more rapidly!
TXT_KEY_NOTIFICATION_MINOR_BFF_LOST_RESO: {1_CivName:textkey} has lost access to the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{2_ResourceNames}[ENDCOLOR] it was providing you! No new shipments can be made until it is reconnected.
TXT_KEY_NOTIFICATION_MINOR_BARB_KILLED: You have killed a group of Barbarians near {1_CivName:textkey}! They are grateful, and your [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence with them has increased by 12!
TXT_KEY_DIPLO_MINOR_ALLY_AT_WAR: City-State is allied with a player at war with the leader you're speaking with.
TXT_KEY_CITIES_ATTACKINGRANGEDUNITS_HEAD: Although you can attack a city and wear it down with ranged units, you cannot capture the city with a ranged unit; you must move a melee unit into the city to take it. Similarly, air units and ranged water units cannot capture a city, though they can wear its defenses down to nothing.
TXT_KEY_NOTIFICATION_MINOR_AGGRESSOR: Your aggression against your weaker neighbors has not gone unnoticed. They have begun banding together for mutual defense, and will fight to the death. Should you continue attacking City-States, more will join the alliance.
TXT_KEY_LEADER_WASHINGTON_ATTACKED_2: You infamous villain - you shall regret this!
TXT_KEY_CIVILOPEDIA_LEADERS_BISMARCK_TEX: As a diplomat, Bismarck's greatest weakness was his single-minded desire to weaken France. He was largely successful during his lifetime, but in doing so he made France into an implacable enemy, which would have dire consequences in the next century. Domestically, Bismarck's great flaw was his indifference to the lives of the German people. As Germany grew in power and stature, the people's lives improved but little. His social security system did some good, but he enacted that mainly to avoid having to make greater concessions to the German Socialists.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Bismarck was a great leader, perhaps the greatest European leader of the 19th Century. His triumphs outweighed his defeats, and he almost single-handedly turned a group of bickering kingdoms into a mighty state. Although his policies did contribute to the disasters in Germany's future, those were more so a result of his successors' inability to adjust to the changing geopolitical climate in Europe.
TXT_KEY_CITY_STATE_QUEST_GREAT_PERSON: We seek the wisdom of a {1_UnitName:textkey}. We would be delighted if you could attract one to your lands.
TXT_KEY_NOTIFICATION_LEAGUE_VOTING_RESUL: The Special Session of the {1_LeagueName} has chosen {@2_CivName} to be the next host.
TXT_KEY_NOTIFICATION_CULTURE_VICTORY_WIT: {1_CivName} only needs their culture to become Influential with 2 more civilizations to win a Culture Victory.
TXT_KEY_NOTIFICATION_LEAGUE_VOTING_RESUL: {1_ResolutionName} was passed.  Its effects are [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]now active[ENDCOLOR].
TXT_KEY_LEADER_GANDHI_DEFEATED_2: You have conquered an innocent and helpless people. I congratulate you.
TXT_KEY_NOTIFICATION_LEAGUE_VOTING_DONE_: The proposed resolutions to the {1_LeagueName} have been decided on.
TXT_KEY_KOREA_SCENARIO_BUILDING_PAPER_MA: The Paper Maker is the Chinese unique building, replacing the Bank. The Paper Maker increases the city's intake of gold.
TXT_KEY_NOTIFICATION_LEAGUE_PROJECT_PROG: The {@1_ProjectName} project is now [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{2_PercentComplete}[ENDCOLOR]% complete.  To contribute towards its completion and earn rewards, choose the project in the city production list.
TXT_KEY_NOTIFICATION_KILLED_A_SPY: Your spy {1_SpyRank} {2_SpyName} killed {TXT_KEY_GRAMMAR_A_AN << {3_CivAdj}} spy in {4_CityName} while they were trying to steal a technology!
TXT_KEY_NOTIFICATION_INTRIGUE_SNEAK_ATTA: {1_SpyRank} {2_SpyName} discovered that {TXT_KEY_GRAMMAR_A_AN << {3_CivAdj}} army is currently marching toward you to launch a surprise attack!
TXT_KEY_CIV5_NETHERLANDS_TEXT_15: Throughout its history, the Netherlands has produced some of the world's most esteemed artists, scientists, researchers, and scholars, many of whom were integral in establishing the foundations of modern practice in their respective fields. Renowned painters Rembrandt van Rijn and Vincent Van Gogh were both Dutch, and today their work is among the most admired-and valuable- in the art world. Scientists such as Christiaan Huygens, who was the first to discover the rings of Saturn, and Antonie van Leeuwenhoek, the "Father of Microbiology," both made immense contributions to the future of scientific discovery.
TXT_KEY_CIV5_ETHIOPIA_TEXT_2: Ethiopia, Africa's tenth largest nation, covers the majority of the Horn of Africa, nestled along the continent's northeastern coast. Bisected by the Great Rift Valley, Ethiopia's geography is dominated by highly elevated plateaus and disjointed mountain ranges. Sitting atop the African tectonic plate, which has been in the process of splitting apart for millions of years, Ethiopia has found itself on the receiving end of frequent earthquakes throughout history. The country is also home to several dozen active and dormant volcanoes, including Erta Ale, one of the few volcanoes in the world with an ever-present lake of lava on its summit. The climate of Ethiopia varies greatly, although the nation as a whole is part of a tropical zone with heavy rainfall during the summer monsoon season followed by a dry, moderate winter.
TXT_KEY_NOTIFICATION_INTRIGUE_SNEAK_ATTA: {1_SpyRank} {2_SpyName} discovered that {TXT_KEY_GRAMMAR_A_AN << {3_CivAdj}} army is currently marching a surprise attack against another civilization. We do not know which civ they are targeting.

TXT_KEY_DQ_LEADER_NAME_17_QUOTE: There is no pleasure in having nothing to do; the fun is having lots to do and not doing it.

TXT_KEY_UNIT_HELP_TANK: Fast and powerful late game Unit.

TXT_KEY_GENERIC_DOW_DESPERATE_6: Your incredible strength will not deter me from finding a way to defeat you. May the fates smile on me.
TXT_KEY_NOTIFICATION_GREAT_WORK_MUSIC_SW: {1_LeaderName} has swapped your Great Work of Music "{2_Work1Name}" for the Great Work "{3_Work2Name}."
TXT_KEY_LEADER_ELIZABETH_TRIBUTE_NO_ANGR: You presume to demand tribute from Us? Go away, you hateful villain!

TXT_KEY_CIV5_ROME_TEXT_6: The First Punic War (264 - 241 BC) found the Carthaginian mercenary army no match for the Roman legions, who inflicted upon them a massive defeat at the Battle of Agrigentum in 261 BC. The elite Carthaginian navy had much better initial success against the untried Roman navy, but over time this advantage faded as the Romans constructed new vessels and gained combat experience. Eventually the Carthaginians admitted they were overmatched and ceded Sicily to Rome. Shortly thereafter the Romans took advantage of unrest in the Carthaginian army to take the Carthaginian islands of Corsica and Sardinia, as well.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]With Rome restricting Carthaginian operations in the Central Mediterranean, Carthage sought to recoup its losses by expanding into Spain. Rome responded by allying with the Spanish city of Saguntum, making it clear that they were going to oppose Carthage's interests pretty much anywhere on the Mediterranean. In 219 BC the Carthaginian general Hannibal laid siege to Saguntum and Rome declared war once again. The Second Punic War (219 - 201 BC) had begun.
TXT_KEY_CIV5_MOROCCO_TEXT_2: Much of modern Morocco is mountainous; the Rif Mountains border the Mediterranean from the northwest to the northeast, and the Atlas Mountains run from the northeast to the southwest through the center of Morocco. The western Saharan desert covers most of the southeast portion of the country. The Maghreb is marked by a Mediterranean climate in the north between the Atlas Mountains and the coast and the arid Sahara to the south. Thus, the northern areas of Morocco enjoy cool, wet winters and warm, dry summers, while the Sahara is characterized by extreme heat and a lack of precipitation. The coastal plains have been heavily cultivated since the earliest arrival of human beings in the region. Where the Rif Mountains tend to be barren, covered with grasses and moss, the higher Atlas Mountains were thick with oak, juniper, and cedar forests and many species of game through most of recorded history. By contrast, the Sahara contains only sand dunes and rocky outcrops, broken by the occasional oasis. While other peoples colonized along the rich coastlines, it was the harsh Rif and Atlas mountains that gave rise to the native Berber peoples.

TXT_KEY_UNIT_LANDSHIP_TEXT: The Landship was everything the land ironclad was to be but was not.  The discovery of luboric increased the energy available to power such a vehicle exponentially, allowing for more armor and weaponry while maintaining the same maneuverability.  It became the gold standard on the battlefield, capable of destroying nearly any other land unit.  With several of them, a commander could quickly take out an army or encircle a city.

TXT_KEY_CIV5_ETHIOPIA_TEXT_12: Known today as the Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia, the nation faces a number of major socio-economic issues as the second most populous country in Africa. The wide-ranging geographic isolation facing some groups within the country has made it increasingly difficult to provide education, healthcare, and, in many cases, the basic necessities of life. Although the nation currently holds multiparty elections, corruption within the government is a constant concern, and crackdowns in recent years have led to international condemnation over the killing of protesters and opposition party members.

TXT_KEY_CIV5_POLICY_SLAVERY_TEXT: Slavery is a system in which people can be the property of other people. Slaves can be bought or sold, forced to labor, and have few (usually no) rights. Slavery has been around for as long as human history. In some instances people captured in war were made slaves. In others, people of another tribe, or country, or race or religion were considered sub-human and subject to enslavement. Sometimes extreme poverty or indebtedness or a criminal record can result in enslavement. In some cultures, enslavement was not necessarily permanent. A slave could work his or her way to freedom or be automatically manumitted (freed) after a certain period of time.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]In most modern cultures, slavery is universally condemned as a very bad practice which exploits the slave and corrupts the slaveholder. While it has been largely eradicated, many argue that it still exists in some forms - in prison labor camps, unpaid domesticate servants, enforced prostitution, and the like.

TXT_KEY_CIV5_BUILDINGS_LIBRARY_TEXT: A library is a building housing a collection of books, scrolls, and other written material. TXT_KEY_CIVILOPEDIA_LEADERS_HARUN_TEXT_4: A somewhat fantastic description of Harun may be found in "The Thousand and One Nights," in which the Caliph is described as living in a sumptuous palace flowing with gold, silver, and jewels. Although exaggerated, there is a strong element of truth to the tale. During Harun's reign huge amounts of wealth poured into the Empire, and a goodly portion of it made it to the Caliph's coffers. According to ancient historians, Harun's wife insisted that all utensils and plates at her table be made of gold and festooned with jewels.

TXT_KEY_CIV5_RESOURCE_OIL_TEXT: Oil is a liquid fuel found in large and small deposits across the world. Although occasionally used by some civilizations as far as four thousand years ago to create asphalt or naptha or burned as a light source, modern use can be traced back to 1857 when the first modern refinery was constructed in Alsace, France. At about the same time wells were being drilled across Europe and in North America. By the early 20th century oil was in great demand, largely due to its use in internal combustion engines as used by ships, planes, and automobiles. Today much of international politics is driven by growing tension between those who have abundant sources of oil, and those who do not. Remember that oil is a strategic resource, and thus it is consumed as you construct the associated units and buildings.
TXT_KEY_AIRPOWER_STEALTH_ADV_QUEST: Where can stealth bombers be based?
TXT_KEY_NEWWORLD_SCENARIO_UNIT_HELP_MAYA: Only the Maya may build this unit. It is cheaper and available sooner than the Archer, which it replaces.
TXT_KEY_NEWWORLD_SCENARIO_UNITS_TREASURE: The Treasure Unit encompasses the entirety of the Spanish Treasure Fleet system in the New World, from mine to destination. After gold or silver was excavated in various locations in the Americas, it was shipped along land by llama and mule, traveling well-documented routes to specific port towns along the Spanish Main.  From these ports, the treasure was then loaded onto galleons and merchant vessels, which traveled together in a massive convoy across the Atlantic Ocean. These ships followed a precise path each time they crossed the Atlantic to Spain, allowing themselves to be easily protected from pirates and thieves.  These treasure units helped make Spain the wealthiest civilization at the time, and were instrumental in the creation of one of the world’s most impressive naval operations.
TXT_KEY_NEWWORLD_SCENARIO_LEADER_PACAL_W: I knew this was a waste of time...
TXT_KEY_CIV5_SIAM_TEXT_2: Siam is a semi-tropical country located in a monsoon zone. From May to October warm northwestern winds bring huge amounts of rainfall to the country, the west coast receiving an astonishing 160 inches of rain annually (the hilly north much less so). The wind reverses course from November to February, bringing cooler, drier weather to the country. The countryside is covered with forests, swamps and wetlands. The Siamese people have traditionally used water buffalo, horses, and even elephants as draft animals (though the late 20th century has seen the introduction of farm machinery across much of the country).
TXT_KEY_NEWWORLD_SCENARIO_UNITS_MYSTIC_W: The braves of various North American tribes during times of conflict were consecrated in elaborate, mystical ceremonies meant to increase their courage, strength, skill and/or survival. The earliest record of such "mystic warriors" comes from the Pequot war with English colonists (1634-1638 AD), but examples abound throughout the histories of the Northeastern and Plains Indians.

TXT_KEY_CIV5_KAMEHAMEHA_TEXT_3: After Alapa'i's death, Kamehameha became an aide in the new chief's court.  This lasted until 1782, when the kingship moved on to a new ruler and Kamehameha was promoted to an important religious position.  With this new found power, Kamehameha began to build himself a support base among the lesser chiefs of the Kona district of the Big Island.  Eventually garnering the support of five chiefs, Kamehameha challenged the local court.  At the battle of Moku'ohai, Kamehameha's forces defeated the ruling chief and Kamehameha became the new ruler of the Kohala, Kona, and Hamakua districts.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]From here, Kamehameha successfully conquered the neighboring district of Puna in 1790, but soon had to face an uprising in Ka'u led by rival Keōua Kuahu'ula. Ever a religious man, Kamehameha constructed a large temple in a bid to gain the favor of his gods and the divine blessing to quash the rebellion.  In 1791 the temple was finished, and Kamehamea invited Keōua to meet with him.  Accounts differ on exactly what happened at that fateful meeting on the beach, but in the end Keōua was killed by musket fire and Kamehameha became the King of all the Big Island.
TXT_KEY_NEWWORLD_SCENARIO_TECH_ROYAL_GUA: Allows you to build the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Musketeer[ENDCOLOR], an enhanced version of the standard Musketman.
TXT_KEY_LEADER_KAMEHAMEHA_ATTACKED_1: You dare ignore the sacred Laws of the Splintered Paddle? Our conflict saddens me greatly, but I must protect my people.
TXT_KEY_NEWWORLD_SCENARIO_TECH_RELIGIOUS: Allows you to build buildings with [ICON_PEACE] Faith and the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Grand Temple[ENDCOLOR], which allows all Missionaries to spread three times.

In many world religions, there exist special communities and organizations of devout individuals who live apart from the majority of society, usually to keep more perfectly in line with their specific religious beliefs.  These religious orders often take the physical form of monasteries, a building or complex where the pious can work and live.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]While some religious orders were content to reside and pray in their native countries, some instead were founded for the sole purpose of expansion and spreading their beliefs to new peoples.  The Jesuit missionaries in the Americas were one such religious order. These Jesuits traveled across the Atlantic and set up monasteries and missions on the American soil, where they taught the local people the tenets of their faith and the basics of western education.

TXT_KEY_NEWWORLD_SCENARIO_TECH_PIRACY_DE: Raiding, pillaging, unspeakable violence at sea - a pirate's life is a good one.  Often romanticized by popular film and media, pirates are anything but the witty, wisecracking Captain Jack Sparrows and Pirate Kings entertaining the young masses. These naval criminals took cargo by force from other ships, raided seaside towns, and were a general menace to all forms of civilized society. Piracy has probably been around for as long as civilizations have ported goods and peoples across the seas - one of the earliest records of piracy dates back to the 13th century BC.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Some of the most famous piracy accounts are attributed to the European Vikings, who terrorized coastal villages and holdings, and the Caribbean pirates, who generally liked to seize Spanish treasure ships fat and heavy with gold.  This “classic” era of piracy is the one most commonly depicted in films and books, and lasted from about 1560 to 1720.  While this illustrious pirate with saber sword and jaunty hat is relegated now to the work of fiction, piracy is still found rampant in many waters, especially off the coast of the Arabian Peninsula.   Piracy however should not be confused or interchanged with the act of privateering, a form of naval raiding authorized by a legal government, usually for wartime benefit.

TXT_KEY_NEWWORLD_SCENARIO_TECH_LINE_OF_B: Although its first use in battle is a matter of debate (ranging from 1502 to 1652 AD), by 1675 the "line-of-battle" tactic was the most common formation being used by European navies. In contrast to the usual naval melees, in line-of-battle each warship could fire its broadside without hitting friendly vessels, allowing for both concentrated and continuous fire.

TXT_KEY_CIVILOPEDIA_LEADERS_AUGUSTUS_TEX: Antony married Octavius' sister Octavia to cement their alliance, and the two leaders divided Rome's territory between them. Octavius took the west, while Antony went to the east, where he entered into a torrid affair with Cleopatra, the ruler of Egypt. Octavius saw Antony's actions as an insult to his sister and to his family, and relations between the co-rulers soon soured. While Antony enjoyed the pleasures of Egypt, back in Rome Octavius strengthened his political position and his armies. The two eventually went to war, and in 31 BC Octavius defeated the forces of Antony and Cleopatra at the naval battle of Actium. The lovers were pursued to Egypt, where they both committed suicide.
TXT_KEY_NEWWORLD_SCENARIO_TECH_ADVANCED_: The "Golden Age of Piracy" spanned, roughly, the years from 1650 to 1730 AD as the likes of Henry Morgan, Bartholomew Roberts and Calico Jack Rackham sailed the Spanish Main. It was brought about by both the incredible riches being shipped to Europe from the New World and by advances in shipbuilding, allowing fast and nimble sloops, brigantines and schooners to carry heavier weaponry and larger crews.
TXT_KEY_GREAT_WORK_PARTHENON_FRIEZE: Phidias Showing the Frieze of the Parthenon to his Friends (Lawrence Alma-Tadema)

TXT_KEY_NEWWORLD_SCENARIO_LEADER_ISABELL: All is lost. Evil has triumphed - for now. But beware, for Heaven will surely be victorious in the end!
TXT_KEY_CIV5_YEREVAN_TEXT: Standing among the oldest cities in the world, Yerevan, the present-day capital of Armenia, traces its founding to the construction of the Erebuni fortress in 782 BC by King Argishti I of Urartu. Since that time, Yerevan has fallen under the rule of a number of powerful empires, having been conquered during the Arab invasions of the 7th century AD. It was during this period that Yerevan became an important stopover along the caravan routes connecting Europe to Asia. In the present-day, Yerevan is known for the many industries based in the city, which account for more than 50% of Armenia's total industrial output. Industries producing heavy machinery, chemicals, raw materials, and textiles, have all contributed to the city's growing economy. Yerevan also plays an important role in Armenia's reputation for producing high quality alcohol, as a number of manufacturers are based within the city.
