TXT_KEY_CIV5_IMPROVEMENTS_TRADING_POST_T: Trading Posts are outposts where hunters and trappers may sell their wares to civilians in exchange for food, weapons, whiskey, gold, and all of the other trappings of society. They can generate a lot of wealth for a society.
TXT_KEY_SCIENCESTRATEGY_INFO_DOING_POORL: Our civilization is producing {1_Num} [ICON_RESEARCH]science with our {2_Num} [ICON_CITIZEN] population. We should focus on improving our research by building research buildings like libraries and universities.
TXT_KEY_ADDITIONAL_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE_R: Allows establishing an additional trade route.
TXT_KEY_CIV5_RESOURCE_SHEEP_TEXT: Sheep are extremely tasty creatures that also produce milk, wool and leather. One of the earliest animals to be domesticated, sheep were first tamed in Mesopotamia some ten thousand years ago. Since that period the practice of shepherding has spread widely, and today sheep can be found across the planet. There are over 200 breeds of sheep in existence, each bred for a specific quality: hardiness, size, quantity and quality of wool, milk production, and of course tastiness!
TXT_KEY_BARBARIAN_TREASURE_ADV_QUEST: How can an ancient ruin provide you with gold?
TXT_KEY_AICITYSTRATEGY_ENOUGH_TILE_IMPRO: I don't think {1_CityName:textkey} needs to build any more Workers right now.
TXT_KEY_RESOURCES_CITYREQUESTS_HEADING3_: Periodically a city may request that you acquire a specific luxury resource. If you do so, the city will go into "We Love the King Day" for 20 turns, during which the city's growth rate is increased by 25%. When the 20 turns are over, the city will demand another luxury resource. Filling that request will cause the city to resume WLtKD for another 20 turns.
TXT_KEY_LEADER_SEJONG_TRADE_NEEDMORE_ANG: Trained though you may be in the arts of negotiation, this insulting offer cannot stand as it is.  Improve it immediately.
TXT_KEY_AIR_PATROL_FOUND_NOTHING: The air patrol with your {@1_UnitName} encountered no resistance!
TXT_KEY_ADVISOR_CONGRESS_PROPOSE_BODY: Because you're either the host, or have the most delegates, you're able to propose a Resolution. You can choose resolution that can help your people, or apply pressure to others. Some Resolutions have diplomatic consequences, so choose carefully!
TXT_KEY_PEDIA_WORLD_CONGRESS_HOMEPAGE_TE: Some great things are only possible through international cooperation. History has seen many examples of nations coming together for mutual benefit and decision making, from the trade-focused Hanseatic League to the more recent League of Nations. The twentieth century saw a new level of international cooperation begin with the United Nations.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]In Civilization V, the "World Congress" represents these diplomatic interactions between multiple parties and acts as the path to Diplomatic Victory. In this diplomatic body, all civilizations have the chance to decide on game-changing effects in the form of "Resolutions." In addition, "International Projects" can be built, which combine the production efforts of multiple civilizations to benefit those who contribute.
TXT_KEY_BUILDING_COFFEE_HOUSE_STRATEGY: The Coffee House is a Renaissance-era building unique to Austria, replacing the Windmill. It increases the city's [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and speed at which [ICON_GREAT_PEOPLE] Great People are generated by 25%.
TXT_KEY_CIV5_MAYA_TEXT_12: There are an estimated seven million contemporary Maya living throughout parts of Mexico, Belize, Guatemala, Honduras, and El Salvador in the present day, many of whom still maintain aspects of their cultural heritage. Although there are more than 20 distinct languages separating the Maya, like their ancestors they are joined by a common culture and tradition, and together they continue to celebrate the legacy of the ancient Maya.
TXT_KEY_TP_CARNIVAL_EFFECT: Because of your unique Carnival bonus, Tourism output is currently +100% with all civilizations and you are earning Great Writers, Artists, and Musicians 50% faster.
TXT_KEY_CIV5_IMPROVEMENTS_TITLE6_TEXT: Coastal improvements are like other improvements, except that they are constructed at sea by work boats, which are built in coastal cities. Unlike workers, work boats are consumed when they build an improvement, so you need to build multiple work boats for multiple improvements.
